commit_message:
DNM: Fix subunit.parser error

The reason for parsing error is when any functional test fails
it tries to attach entire api.log file and registry.log file to the
test result.

Skipped adding entire registry logs to the output on failure.

Change-Id: I5f3bc734c63749ac1cdc34404d9243e2651e6936

commit_message:
Fix tox.ini to correctly test lower-constraints

Due to the way we currently define install_command, all test targets
are using upper-constraints, including the lower-constraints one.
This patch fixes it and adds standard things like passing proxy settings.

Change-Id: I61c3b45ae591ea44688f29598cb8b802bb094423
(cherry picked from commit 91ed55678ee662df36794bf1f79153e6585023d6)

commit_message:
Correct the PDF filename

The zuul job assumes doc-<repo>.pdf as the generated PDF file.
It was changed after the original PDF build patch was pushed
and I forgot to update it. This commit fixes it.

Change-Id: Idbea72514b8869a9a194987ddde36abe369b5496
Story: 2006099
Task: 35123

Multi-listener LB commit (Idaccbcfa0126f1e26fbb3ad770c65c9266cfad5b)
introduced a v2 message for octavia healthmonitor.

This commit fixes an issue with healthmonitor messages for UDP
listeners, they didn't follow the v2 message specification: pools
dictionaries were stored in listener objects (v1 format) instead of
being stored as in the root dictionary of the message.

listeners, they didn't follow the v2 message specification: pools
dictionaries were stored in listener objects (v1 format) instead of

Story: 2005736

commit_message:
Fix healthmonitor message v2 for UDP listeners

Multi-listener LB commit (Idaccbcfa0126f1e26fbb3ad770c65c9266cfad5b)
introduced a v2 message for octavia healthmonitor.

This commit fixes an issue with healthmonitor messages for UDP
listeners, they didn't follow the v2 message specification: pools
dictionaries were stored in listener objects (v1 format) instead of
being stored as in the root dictionary of the message.

Story: 2005736
Task: 33394

Change-Id: I93e5eb5bc69fe4de4c450c09367b319769ef07db

[{'created': '2019-09-26 19:54:37.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Id2be379947a39ffdaf87a252c4d8c1bc0160ff06
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Id2be379947a39ffdaf87a252c4d8c1bc0160ff06

'}, {'created': '2019-09-27 08:03:03.000000000', 'message': "Fix certificate directory creation

Change-Id: I21dfffa9b30274fa0fa9f365a88222b8f4c89e29

commit_message:
Fix certificate directory creation

When calling ./stack.sh twice, octavia devstack plugin fails because
local certificate directory already exists.

This commit deletes the directory each time a certificate creation
script is called and when the user cleans up his devstack's
installation.

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: I7240d59e81529cd787a3975cc834208ec5db3deb
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
CI: add Debian/binary job

While we do not get up-to-date Debian packages (usually one release back)
it would be nice to see how situation looks.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/683680

Is there a reason why we need this (how often do things break)?  What additional coverage (of upper-constraints/global-requirements changes) does it give us?'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2019-09-30 05:57:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Is there a reason why we need this (how often do things break)? 
 > What additional coverage (of upper-constraints/global-requirements
 > changes) does it give us?

No number of "how often does it break", but right now the whole tripleoclient is unable to merge anything due to an update related to py27.

This patch might become useless with https://review.opendev.org/#/c/685378/ though, unless we can move it to unvoting as well in here? Not really sure what's best. py27 will be dropped as soon as we get centos-8 CI jobs instead of centos-8 anyway.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2019-10-01 08:06:21.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

test has been deactivated on tripleoclient, no need for this one now.'}]

commit_message:
Add bindep.txt to fix unit tests

The unit tests fail since no mysqladmin command is installed, add
bindep.txt to install the needed binaries in our CI environment.

Add also the usual bindep tox environment for developers.

This commit includes the following unrelated changes
to pass the gate
------------------------------------------------------------
Fix versions of neutron and friends

Change-Id: Ia109c6eba2cff529949567b0af821985a7f9efdf
------------------------------------------------------------
Update sphinx requirements

After the recent change in the global requirements. [1]

[1] If558f184c959e4b63b56dec3ca1571d1034cfe5c

Closes-Bug: #1829118
Change-Id: I41ffeebb52d094d85089fd74b89505a0e73535b1
(cherry picked from commit f1a7fccd98d1d463f06be2fb30d5c40c36f5617c)
------------------------------------------------------------

Co-authored-by: YAMAMOTO Takashi <yamamoto@midokura.com>

Change-Id: Ie49b7703dbe5ebf66d9c0abd1bee830044f6b71b
(cherry picked from commit 5a978840f0c9550b8fa51f84c67c5649caf0ae37)

When hosts apply config `CONF.force_config_drive=True`, the existing
VMs shouldn't be enforced to must have config drive device. For they

commit_message:
Skip existing VMs when hosts apply force_config_drive

When hosts apply config `CONF.force_config_drive=True`, the existing
VMs shouldn't be enforced to must have config drive device. For they
may have been cloud-inited via metadata service, and may not need and
have any config drive device ever. In contrast, the newly being-built
ones should. Instance attr `launched_at` serves as an apparent flag
to distinguish the two kinds of VMs.

When hard reboots happend, existing VMs skip config drive enforcement,
and therefore avoid hitting 'No such file or directory (config drive
device)' error.

Change-Id: I0558ece92f8657c2f6294e07965c619eb7c8dfcf
Closes-Bug: #1827492
(cherry picked from commit 2af89cfea0531ab75b4f5765bb220073f42662d0)
(cherry picked from commit b919d5d97356e1f7d58cba8d5fc264b3b851ad22)
(cherry picked from commit 2a29978fc66dd67708bb06b673852dfcb6c87dd3)

commit_message:
Skip existing VMs when hosts apply force_config_drive

When hosts apply config `CONF.force_config_drive=True`, the existing
VMs shouldn't be enforced to must have config drive device. For they
may have been cloud-inited via metadata service, and may not need and
have any config drive device ever. In contrast, the newly being-built
ones should. Instance attr `launched_at` serves as an apparent flag
to distinguish the two kinds of VMs.

When hard reboots happend, existing VMs skip config drive enforcement,
and therefore avoid hitting 'No such file or directory (config drive
device)' error.

Change-Id: I0558ece92f8657c2f6294e07965c619eb7c8dfcf
Closes-Bug: #1827492
(cherry picked from commit 2af89cfea0531ab75b4f5765bb220073f42662d0)
(cherry picked from commit b919d5d97356e1f7d58cba8d5fc264b3b851ad22)

commit_message:
Skip existing VMs when hosts apply force_config_drive

When hosts apply config `CONF.force_config_drive=True`, the existing
VMs shouldn't be enforced to must have config drive device. For they
may have been cloud-inited via metadata service, and may not need and
have any config drive device ever. In contrast, the newly being-built
ones should. Instance attr `launched_at` serves as an apparent flag
to distinguish the two kinds of VMs.

When hard reboots happend, existing VMs skip config drive enforcement,
and therefore avoid hitting 'No such file or directory (config drive
device)' error.

Change-Id: I0558ece92f8657c2f6294e07965c619eb7c8dfcf
Closes-Bug: #1827492
(cherry picked from commit 2af89cfea0531ab75b4f5765bb220073f42662d0)

commit_message:
Give volume DriverBlockDevice classes a common prefix

This makes the code slightly easier to understand, for example because
it's more obvious that DriverVolImageBlockDevice is a volume. It will
also be less confusing when we add DriverLocalImageBlockDevice in a
future patch.

Rename things in test_block_device for the same reasons.

Part of bp local-disk-serial-numbers

Change-Id: I5aa41a675d79945df6293f46eeb1a2fcc67241fb
(cherry picked from commit fe2bfe518e1634bcb08ba5bfc30d2b763bcb0131)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-23 22:37:48.000000000', 'message': 'Make TC size configurable

With the goal to reduce the TC to 9, we should be able to configure
the size of the TC in a var.

All the required votes were changed to be counted from the TC size
instead of being staticly defined.

The term "majority" term was appropriately adapted:
sensu stricto it means above 50%. It was replaced by supramajority
(for stronger requirements) or reached enough votes
(for lower requirements).

This made it possible to see the fact that majority was wrongly used
for "formal-vote". The "can_approve = 'YES'" used everywhere
didn't really mean a positive workflow for "formal-vote", as majority
is maybe not reached and votes could be flipped. This separates
a "YES" (a technical 'YES' which could be extended
with the majority condition) from a definitive "CAN APPROVE".

Change-Id: I4682c8795ca8d912ed3fa1951c98a90a34c4352c
'}]
commit_message:
Make TC size configurable

With the goal to reduce the TC to 9, we should be able to configure
the size of the TC in a var.

All the required votes were changed to be counted from the TC size
instead of being staticly defined.

The term "majority" term was appropriately adapted:
sensu stricto it means above 50%. It was replaced by supramajority
(for stronger requirements) or reached enough votes
(for lower requirements).

This made it possible to see the fact that majority was wrongly used
for "formal-vote". The "can_approve = 'YES'" used everywhere
didn't really mean a positive workflow for "formal-vote", as majority
is maybe not reached and votes could be flipped. This separates
a "YES" (a technical 'YES' which could be extended
with the majority condition) from a definitive "CAN APPROVE".

Change-Id: I4682c8795ca8d912ed3fa1951c98a90a34c4352c

commit_message:
tox: use the right nova branch for stable/train

At the moment, the tests use the latest Nova branch, which doesn't
work with stable/train compute-hyperv. This change updates the
tox config so that the right Nova branch will be used.

Change-Id: I2637741fffe1bac81c9e49f33207f1e37d0939df

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: Ie9a285b88b2544ff7f73ed9de7aade432b681d08
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I6c1761fb0ca866921ed5a17386936b2219bf47fe

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic69be007b8aeeefe099de5500faf06b3aa89fbdb

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

[{'created': '2019-07-29 19:42:43.000000000', 'message': 'loadbalancer vip-network-id IP availability check

The existing code selects the first IPv4 subnet in the network without
any consideration of ip availability.  If not enough IPs are available,
the loadbalancer creations fails.  This patch uses neutron ip
availability API to check the quantity of free IPs when creating
loadbalancer with vip-network-id and skips subnets that do not have
enough IPs for a loadbalancer on multi subnet networks.

Change-Id: If3c3cf9be085bb95b4ebbaf71e24f92d42b8d6e0
Task: 36004
Story: 2006293

commit_message:
loadbalancer vip-network-id IP availability check

The existing code selects the first IPv4 subnet in the network without
any consideration of ip availability.  If not enough IPs are available,
the loadbalancer creations fails.  This patch uses neutron ip
availability API to check the quantity of free IPs when creating
loadbalancer with vip-network-id and skips subnets that do not have
enough IPs for a loadbalancer on multi subnet networks.

Change-Id: If3c3cf9be085bb95b4ebbaf71e24f92d42b8d6e0
Task: 36004
Story: 2006293

commit_message:
python2/3 cmpatible sorted function

In python3.0 the cmp parameter was removed from sorted function.
Using functools.cmp_to_key() instead.

Change-Id: I8cd7856a625107602df1f584b22806a8534a3142

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-27 15:26:39.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ife2a8d3d51f2f8ecd8284d5412e07164a2106885
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ife2a8d3d51f2f8ecd8284d5412e07164a2106885

Update master for stable/train

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-16 17:14:33.000000000', 'message': 'Move Octavia agent containers to step 5

Octavia uses external deploy steps to complete configuration of the
support services, requiring a restart to pick these changes up if the
services are started in step 4. This patch moves the startup of these
services to step 5 avoiding the need for restarting.

This was actually causing an issue with healthchecks as the restart was
happening during the restart.

Change-Id: I4d7d322c2d64ed06b71ab0da049cf92f5a8e8d8a
Related-Bug: #1843981
'}]
commit_message:
Move Octavia agent containers to step 5

Octavia uses external deploy steps to complete configuration of the
support services, requiring a restart to pick these changes up if the
services are started in step 4. This patch moves the startup of these
services to step 5 avoiding the need for restarting.

This was actually causing an issue with healthchecks as the restart was
happening during the restart.

Change-Id: I4d7d322c2d64ed06b71ab0da049cf92f5a8e8d8a
Related-Bug: #1843981

commit_message:
Run container prepare without gathering facts

Good amount of time is taken by gather facts, skip it since it is not
necessary. The modify image role does not rely on any facts.

Change-Id: I54220c9a8fcd1a84c428f9c663dbd4e4b5aff098
(cherry picked from commit a2d180ff7014f975cc795bf375564ddf38a12621)

commit_message:
Fix config file documentation

The documentation currently uses '[default]' (lower case).
This configuration is not picket up.
It needs to be upper case.

Change-Id: Icbc5e7ee5178be1054b045045245d384a3957a63
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <Andreas.Florath@telekom.de>

commit_message:
Support networking-ansible-ml2 coordination

Networking-ansible-ml2 now has a dependency on tooz in order to prevent
parallel updates on switches that do not support them. This patch
adds in the components required for the rediz backend used by
tooz to coordinate distributed locks

Depends-On: I09ae3a4ab3a473484fe71db4b79cd6fc7b93b617

Change-Id: Ifdcc3004e4c3baa0bf6e75f0c0f045e1101d800a

commit_message:
OvS DPDK derive parameters timeout issue

This change is to fix the OvS DPDK derive parameters timeout
issue. OvS DPDK parameters and NUMA aware vSwitch parameters are not
derived and getting timeout issue.

Change-Id: If3841210a5d5cf125058cc3e5cf4de2905fae42b
Closes-Bug: #1842042
(cherry picked from commit 135e65e02f9382dd0e1aaa131b694dd5f5c8d29a)
(cherry picked from commit 7efce38a7b754d0999a0a1580598a78d30289d99)

commit_message:
remove unessisary blocks

These roles have no vars files so theres no need to try and load
vars that dont exist.

Change-Id: I93ceedc4eb092a356f42f5f5823bea0729a2be27
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

subject: Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train
messages: [{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-27 18:48:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2019-09-30 23:39:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-27 17:03:12.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I0ba950679992d81913bffd1492631576ad379f80
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I0ba950679992d81913bffd1492631576ad379f80

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Fix properties in nova_aggregate provider for osc >= 4.0.0

Similar to I6a68505d15473b140c85a199a09d2fee45864800

Openstackclient 4.0.0 changed the way some properties are displayed
on screen.

Old:
...,"Properties"
...,"foo='bar'"

New:
...,"Properties"
...,"{u'foo': u'bar'}"
or
...,"{'foo': 'bar'}"

This is breaking idempotency on the nova_aggregate provider, since it
does not detect them correctly. This patch aims at fixing this, by
trying to detect the new format, and using JSON parsing in that case.

Closes-Bug: #1845616
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/685537/
Change-Id: I7e8fef9fdb913e53fa459ce09577f574fd059a13

Until we figure it out, let's disable py27 testing which anyway will be

commit_message:
Disable voting on openstack-tox-py27

We believe there is a recent change in stestr that might break python27:
https://github.com/mtreinish/stestr/commit/af0fdae10d9df669d45ccdd152a1ee9da83cc1f0

Until we figure it out, let's disable py27 testing which anyway will be
removed soon once we roll out centos8 testing.

- Disabling voting on openstack-tox-py27
- Remove it from the gate queue
- Stop using the openstack-python-jobs template

Change-Id: I2973ab7c6385f56ccb46f0f0cc82f32cfc56c87c

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Sem-Ver: feature

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I2235fcc48ec695a20b0f21ddf6a4ddeb3d7247cc

messages: [{'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-09-20 14:48:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-09-27 00:16:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-09-27 18:20:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-09-27 21:30:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-09-30 19:26:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-20 14:48:34.000000000', 'message': "[WiP] - Fix Inspector dnsmasq config for IPv6

Extend and re-name the function ipv6_netmask_to_prefix()
to ipv6_normalize_dnsmasq_ip_subnets(). It now changes the
netmask to prefix and wrap gateway addresses in brackets.

Also dnsmasq requires prepending 'option6' to any DHCPv6
options. Options are only honored when in the format:
option6:$NUM. This change use option numbers for IPv6, and
friendly names for IPv4.

Closes-Bug: #1844573
Change-Id: I47d88519acd18630e0d5682d93f1088771ec03a1
"}, {'created': '2019-09-27 00:16:31.000000000', 'message': "Fix Inspector dnsmasq config for IPv6

Extend and re-name the function ipv6_netmask_to_prefix() to
ipv6_normalize_dnsmasq_ip_subnets(). It now changes the netmask
to prefix and removes the 'gateway' if it is an IPv6 subnet.

On IPv6 router info should be provided in router advertisements.
There was a draft to add support in DHCPv6, but it was never
completed.
https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ietf-mif-dhcpv6-route-option/

Also:
  Add match for userclass iPXE and set option6:bootfile-url

Closes-Bug: #1844573
Change-Id: I47d88519acd18630e0d5682d93f1088771ec03a1
"}, {'created': '2019-09-27 18:20:31.000000000', 'message': "Fix Inspector dnsmasq config for IPv6

Extend and re-name the function ipv6_netmask_to_prefix() to
ipv6_normalize_dnsmasq_ip_subnets(). It now changes the netmask
to prefix and removes the 'gateway' if it is an IPv6 subnet.

On IPv6 router info should be provided in router advertisements.
There was a draft to add support in DHCPv6, but it was never
completed.
https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ietf-mif-dhcpv6-route-option/

Also:
  Add match for userclass iPXE and set option6:bootfile-url

Closes-Bug: #1844573
Change-Id: I47d88519acd18630e0d5682d93f1088771ec03a1
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Inspector dnsmasq config for IPv6

Extend and re-name the function ipv6_netmask_to_prefix() to
ipv6_normalize_dnsmasq_ip_subnets(). It now changes the netmask
to prefix and removes the 'gateway' if it is an IPv6 subnet.

On IPv6 router info should be provided in router advertisements.
There was a draft to add support in DHCPv6, but it was never
completed.
https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ietf-mif-dhcpv6-route-option/

Also:
  Add match for userclass iPXE and set option6:bootfile-url

Closes-Bug: #1844573
Change-Id: I47d88519acd18630e0d5682d93f1088771ec03a1

commit_message:
[pxe]/ip_version param in ironic::drivers::pxe

Add the ip_version parameter in the pxe class so that
the IP version that will be used for PXE booting can
be configured.

Closes-Bug: #1845746
Change-Id: Ib29adccc8378bd3e2a46b7d2ca3cfacba55e7674

commit_message:
Add extensible volume mounts to node-exporter

In some instances the prometheus node-exporter provides inaccurate
feedback regarding disk usage. By adding the ability to add additional
mounts, more information about the node's filesystem can be made
available to monitoring services.

Change-Id: I5085a29683dc36099014efb1b11c7db774df501a
Co-Authored-By: Radhika Pai <rp592h@att.com>

commit_message:
Add SecretConsumerMetadatum model and its tests

This patch is the first of a series to implement the Secret Consumers spec:

commit_message:
Do not set public_bind_host and public_port in eventlet section

Remove public_bind_host and public_port configured under eventlet
section as they were alrady deprecated.
Set public_endpoint from public_bind_host and public_port so that
these information can be refered by provider code to get endpoint
even if public_endpoint isn't explicitly given.

Change-Id: Ic38e41b31155a7d3a4f1f5fc606421dd525c1025

commit_message:
Replacing deprecated 'api_paste_config' option

Replacing deprecated 'api_paste_config' option from group 'DEFAULT'
with 'api_paste_config' option from group 'wsgi'.

The configuration was moved to [wsgi] group in Newton:
https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/commit/0b9e378cca2be4e034ad401d71fbe4470907f93a/nova/conf/wsgi.py#L22

Change-Id: I45f4d079656616531f60fef2ba8b76bd301435f9
Closes-bug: #1837133

commit_message:
Conf option cross-reference in config docs

Use the :oslo.config:option:`groupname.optname` syntax within conf
option help strings to cause them to cross-link in the rendered
documentation.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/640057/
Change-Id: Ib0d963bddf374fc0433a6cfb35ba1cf9f6a96ab2

subject: Generate pdf documentation
messages:
[{'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2019-09-16 04:41:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2019-09-16 05:06:49.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to build-pdf-docs'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2019-09-16 06:44:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2019-09-16 09:31:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2019-09-24 09:22:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-09-24 19:51:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2019-09-25 08:53:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2019-09-25 09:07:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Added the pdf packages to bindep.txt since pdf isn't getting generated"}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-09-25 15:48:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-25 21:22:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Why is bindep.txt needed? The zuul job installs rsvg binary during setup [1].
For local build, see L.70 at https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/prepare-build-pdf-docs/tasks/main.yaml'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-25 21:27:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

I cannot find a generated PDF file in the artifacts section of openstack-tox-docs job.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-25 21:28:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-09-25 23:01:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: -Code-Review

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2019-09-26 06:01:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2019-09-26 06:04:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)

Let's see if the pdf gets generated."}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2019-09-26 09:39:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

pdf generated[1], LGTM.

[1] https://e3d5a804cc18a88f2721-40396f62b23a8c83f2b21ec929e1f1fc.ssl.cf2.rackcdn.com/682271/7/check/openstack-tox-docs/131125d/pdf/doc-keystonemiddleware.pdf'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-26 12:04:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

There are minor suggestions in the generated PDF:

- It is better to specify 'extraclassoptions': 'openany' in latex_elements.
  For more detail, see the etherpad https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems (around L.122)
- Looking at p.1 (the first page of the main contents), "Contents:" is not followed by any contents. It looks weird.
- p.17 "1.7 References" has no contents.
- p.29 "INDICES AND TABLES" looks unnecessary in the PDF doc. These pages provided by sphinx works only for HTML docs.

If the keystone team do not care this kind of document quality, please ignore my comments.'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2019-09-27 06:50:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2019-09-27 06:58:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> There are minor suggestions in the generated PDF:
 > 
 > - It is better to specify 'extraclassoptions': 'openany' in
 > latex_elements.
Done
 > For more detail, see the etherpad https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems
 > (around L.122)
 > - Looking at p.1 (the first page of the main contents), "Contents:"
 > is not followed by any contents. It looks weird.
 > - p.17 "1.7 References" has no contents.
 > - p.29 "INDICES AND TABLES" looks unnecessary in the PDF doc. These
 > pages provided by sphinx works only for HTML docs.
 Marking option toctree_only=True should work for this. 
 > If the keystone team do not care this kind of document quality,
 > please ignore my comments.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-27 08:48:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> Marking option toctree_only=True should work for this. 

As a result of toctree_only=True, you drop "Release Notes" and "Contributing" information. Is it what you intend?'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2019-09-27 17:41:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> > Marking option toctree_only=True should work for this.
 > 
 > As a result of toctree_only=True, you drop "Release Notes" and
 > "Contributing" information. Is it what you intend?

No thats not my intention to drop "Release Notes" and Contributing information. I was looking for a way to get rid of Headlines with no contents like References.'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2019-09-27 17:43:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Published edit on patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-09-27 19:33:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-09-30 18:15:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Enable collectd to connect to metrics QDR

This patch enables collectd on overcloud nodes to connect to local QDR
running on each overcloud node.

Depends-On: I4cb6aa95e253b7fd19ed265fbcba0dfe6663592d
Partial-Bug: #1822054
Change-Id: I1d95454f049ca22d694b21b5102e24c63c6009cd
(cherry picked from commit c56e9349f23be8e129159b2e838582c1de287811)

in multiple places inside of the Stable Branch section. As
tripleo-centos-ceph-*.repo is already included above the Stable
Branch section, which should include all fo the Ceph files, the
extra lines were unnecessary and were removed.

Change-Id: Id2912920e67dd8dd3841f94bbeaf747f69df6ed7
'}]
commit_message:
Removed references to tripleo-centos-ceph-jewel.repo

The deployment documentation for deploying the
under cloud, deploy-guide/source/deployment/install_overcloud.rst,
contained deployment instructions which added
/etc/yum.repos.d/tripleo-centos-ceph-jewel.repo to DIB_YUM_REPO_CONF
in multiple places inside of the Stable Branch section. As
tripleo-centos-ceph-*.repo is already included above the Stable
Branch section, which should include all fo the Ceph files, the
extra lines were unnecessary and were removed.

Closes-Bug: #1845574
Change-Id: Id2912920e67dd8dd3841f94bbeaf747f69df6ed7

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie3dc99749ff96550a96c4110f6d28f20a0f753f0

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-30 12:33:38.000000000', 'message': "Fall back to regexes in kolla_toolbox with Docker API 1.24

Since
https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/70b515bf1225e56b7df81677043d75be4bbb1ab4
was merged, we implicitly require Docker API version 1.25
(https://docs.docker.com/engine/api/v1.25/) to support passing
environment variables to docker exec. The version of docker we deployed
before the Docker CE upgrade was 1.12.0, which is Docker API version
1.24, and so does not support this. We get the following error:

    Setting environment for exec is not supported in API < 1.25

This change modifies the kolla_toolbox module to use the new JSON
method for parsing Ansible's output when Docker API 1.25 is available,
falling back to the old regex-based method otherwise.

This change can be reverted when we require a minimum Docker API version
of 1.25+.

Change-Id: Ie671624ecca5b43d7bd8fbd959d701d9e21d66b3
Closes-Bug: #1845681
"}, {'created': '2019-09-30 12:43:38.000000000', 'message': "Fall back to regexes in kolla_toolbox with Docker API 1.24

commit_message:
Fall back to regexes in kolla_toolbox with Docker API 1.24

Since
https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/70b515bf1225e56b7df81677043d75be4bbb1ab4
was merged, we implicitly require Docker API version 1.25
(https://docs.docker.com/engine/api/v1.25/) to support passing
environment variables to docker exec. The version of docker we deployed
before the Docker CE upgrade was 1.12.0, which is Docker API version
1.24, and so does not support this. We get the following error:

    Setting environment for exec is not supported in API < 1.25

This change modifies the kolla_toolbox module to use the new JSON
method for parsing Ansible's output when Docker API 1.25 is available,
falling back to the old regex-based method otherwise.

This change can be reverted when we require a minimum Docker API version
of 1.25+.

Change-Id: Ie671624ecca5b43d7bd8fbd959d701d9e21d66b3
Closes-Bug: #1845681

commit_message:
Drop octaviav2 specific scenarios

Since octaviav1 is retired, we need to make sure, that we're running
only octaviav2 scenarios and not v1. To simplify things let's assume
that octavia was always only v2, and leave v1 to lbaas.

Change-Id: I50efef1eed3feab8ab438d87e87e5d60ca64a913

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-26 14:14:29.000000000', 'message': 'Port check_exec.py to Python 3

This allows "tox -e pep8" to succeed on
CentOS 8.

This is only called from the pep8 env which
already specifies a basepython of python3, so
it should be ok.

Change-Id: Id11e137bc8e1fb50e551639c2be067647c5bc9d4
'}]
commit_message:
Port check_exec.py to Python 3

This allows "tox -e pep8" to succeed on
CentOS 8.

This is only called from the pep8 env which
already specifies a basepython of python3, so
it should be ok.

Change-Id: Id11e137bc8e1fb50e551639c2be067647c5bc9d4

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-27 09:05:18.000000000', 'message': 'Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: I9c976140a94b6257a34b01c94b9239165620ac3b
Sem-Ver: feature
'}]
commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: I9c976140a94b6257a34b01c94b9239165620ac3b
Sem-Ver: feature

[{'account_id': 25562, 'date': '2018-08-01 15:42:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26936, 'date': '2018-08-01 15:48:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

this is a duplicate of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/507486/'}, {'account_id': 25562, 'date': '2018-08-01 16:06:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> this is a duplicate of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/507486/

Yes, I was in the middle of working on this one when it came to me we already have one under review. But it took me some time to work it out, so I would like to have it posted anyway. I know the other patch has received many reviews and is more likely to get merged. But until then I would like to keep it here as an alternative in case it might help.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-08-01 16:56:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-22322 : SUCCESS in 1h 13m 12s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-08-01 17:48:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/587858/1 : FAILURE in 2h 05m 43s'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-08-02 09:30:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This is duplicated with my patch here:https://review.openstack.org/#/c/507486/'}, {'account_id': 25562, 'date': '2018-08-02 10:07:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> This is duplicated with my patch here:https://review.openstack.org/#/c/507486/

Hi Zhenyu, please check my last comment. If you are still active on the topic of concern, just ignore this patch as it is only a record of my work until your patch is merged :)'}, {'account_id': 25562, 'date': '2018-08-02 10:48:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-08-02 12:07:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-22352 : SUCCESS in 1h 18m 19s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-08-02 12:52:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Make nova-manage db archive_delete_rows take --all-cells

This makes archive_delete_rows iterate all cells if specified.

Change-Id: Icff7a6095b5a3a9054533c0c877c5b13eb978054

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3daf0b215f0e5e05dccf6df9c64e5693ab86523e

[{'created': '2019-09-25 21:22:19.000000000', 'message': 'Fix six package on opensuse for pip 10

openSUE Leap 15.0 and 15.1 both provide python3-six version 1.11.0.
Since version 1.12.0 was released, pip>=10 recognizes the version
difference and tries to uninstall the distro-provided version and fails.
This change adds another hack to remove the egg-info file for the six
library so that pip can manage it directly. We also have to wait to

commit_message:
Fix six package on opensuse for pip 10

openSUE Leap 15.0 and 15.1 both provide python3-six version 1.11.0.
Since version 1.12.0 was released, pip>=10 recognizes the version
difference and tries to uninstall the distro-provided version and fails.
This change adds another hack to remove the egg-info file for the six
library so that pip can manage it directly. We also have to wait to
install os-testr until after the fixup has happened since trying to
install it triggers the issue.

Change-Id: I4649abe06b5893a5251bfcdd4234abccde6ceda2

commit_message:
DNM: Add debug logs to fullstack's placement fixture

Based on logstash (see [0])
test_configurations_are_synced_towards_placement sporadically fails.
From logs it seems that the dummy placement wsgi server stops and after
a while it restarts and that causes the issue, but there's no details in
the logs.

[0]: http://logstash.openstack.org/#dashboard/file/logstash.json?query=message%3A%5C%22test_agent_bandwidth_report.py*%20line%20249%2C%20in%20test_configurations_are_synced_towards_placement%5C%22

Change-Id: I15a9d7191ed0cffefe56ccc1732250d15d4b89f9

nova-net: Use nova-net explicitly in 'ApiSampleTestBase' subclasses

As with the effort for remove this from the '_IntegratedTestBase' base
class, setting this explicitly where we need it allows us to identify
those tests that actually need to be migrated and do just that.

class, setting this explicitly where we need it allows us to identify
those tests that actually need to be migrated and do just that.

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

commit_message:
Temporary jobs list change for stable/train

networking-ovn-tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode	does not pass
currently in newly created branch, and tripleo-ci potential fix has an
issue with rocky gates

Temporarily mark the job non-voting (and remove from gate) for
stable/train branch creation, this should be reverted as soon as job is
passing again, probably with https://review.opendev.org/#/c/684260/

Change-Id: I7941f46c9adc7320015bed1e16ab6673137d6ce2

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: I604685b7eab4f6bca06317b56ee0f8e854d0466a
Sem-Ver: feature

The cinder->ceph connection is an egress one from Cinder perspective; this patch set only covers ingress.  There is a separate story for the egress connections. [{'created': '2018-11-01 21:37:33.000000000', 'message': 'Implement east-west nw security policy for Cinder

This patch adds the ingress network security policy for the

commit_message:
Implement east-west nw security policy for Cinder

This patch adds the ingress network security policy for the
Cinder service. It also adds a correction to the glance
ingress network security policy related to Cinder, and modifies
the existing "apparmor" gate job to test security policies and
rename it to a more generic security test gate. Also, it was
necessary to change that gate job to use Ceph instead of NFS,
in order to deploy and test Cinder.

Change-Id: I29cf8bd0b6ec05862182ce31b3566ff1556a523b

commit_message:
Run container prepare without gathering facts

Good amount of time is taken by gather facts, skip it since it is not
necessary. The modify image role does not rely on any facts.

Change-Id: I54220c9a8fcd1a84c428f9c663dbd4e4b5aff098

[{'created': '2019-09-27 15:50:19.000000000', 'message': "Stop filtering out 'accepted' for in-progress migrations

Live migrations are created with an 'accepted' status. Resource claims
on the destination are done with the migration in 'accepted' status.
The status is set to 'preparing' a bit later, right before running
pre_live_migration(). Migrations with status 'accepted' are filtered
out by the database layer when getting in-progress migrations. Thus,
there's a time window after resource claims but before 'preparing'
during which resources have been claimed but the migration is not
considered in-progress by the database layer. During that window, the
instance's host is the source - that's only updated once the live
migration finishes. If the update available resources periodic task
runs during that window, it'll free the instance's resource from the
destination because neither the instance nor any of its in-progress
migrations are associated with the destination. This means that other
incoming instances are able to consume resources that should not be
available. This patch stops filtering out the 'accepted' status in the
database layer when retrieving in-progress migrations.

Change-Id: I4c56925ed35bc3275ca1ac6c30d7fd641ad84260
Closes-bug: 1845146
(cherry picked from commit 6ec686c26b2c8b18bcff522633bfe9715e0feec3)

commit_message:
Stop filtering out 'accepted' for in-progress migrations

Live migrations are created with an 'accepted' status. Resource claims
on the destination are done with the migration in 'accepted' status.
The status is set to 'preparing' a bit later, right before running
pre_live_migration(). Migrations with status 'accepted' are filtered
out by the database layer when getting in-progress migrations. Thus,
there's a time window after resource claims but before 'preparing'
during which resources have been claimed but the migration is not
considered in-progress by the database layer. During that window, the
instance's host is the source - that's only updated once the live
migration finishes. If the update available resources periodic task
runs during that window, it'll free the instance's resource from the
destination because neither the instance nor any of its in-progress
migrations are associated with the destination. This means that other
incoming instances are able to consume resources that should not be
available. This patch stops filtering out the 'accepted' status in the
database layer when retrieving in-progress migrations.

Change-Id: I4c56925ed35bc3275ca1ac6c30d7fd641ad84260
Closes-bug: 1845146
(cherry picked from commit 6ec686c26b2c8b18bcff522633bfe9715e0feec3)

commit_message:
Fix monasca-grafana, fluentd and sensu images

1. monasca-grafana - pin rake to <13

Rake 13.0.0 (released today) depends on Ruby 2.2, but CentOS 7 only
provides Ruby 2.0.

This change pins rake in the monasca-grafana image to versions earlier
than 13.0.0.

2. fluentd on Ubuntu - pin faraday to <0.16

Rocky and earlier only.

Faraday 0.16.x depends on Ruby 2.3+, but td-agent on Ubuntu uses its own
old version of Ruby.

This change pins faraday in the Ubuntu and Debian fluentd images to
versions earlier than 0.16.

3. sensu-client: Pin minitest Ruby gem on CentOS

This was originally in change I1afd2d50c0dc2de6d305b56bd5f9182745fee843
on master and stable/stein.

(cherry picked from commit 305312f1070e80ba849f8c4feb00ad02196b8306)

Change-Id: Id9a76f459aff016fbc920370c0a3ec58e0397fcb
Closes-Bug: #1845647
Closes-Bug: #1845705
Closes-bug: #1845843
(cherry picked from commit a0712ceef3d6c20cdd79417dcff10525c527fb3d)

commit_message:
nova-net: Remove *even* more unnecessary 'USE_NEUTRON = False'

This is the loveliest of the lot, on account of the sheer number of
tests we can switch straight to neutron. Future changes can now focus on
fixing the remaining tests that *do* depend on neutron.

Change-Id: I802fc00a9fd56536fd660080e0c25043b5193d7b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix get plan_name default value for inventory script

Since the default value has been updated to return a list
for the plan_name value, if the os.environ.get is None
then the default is a list with a None value: ['None']

We need to set a real None value, in order to set the
default 'overcloud' value.

Change-Id: Ia84e458c4a79f0a606d15e1b2739b48e5bbda21e

commit_message:
Relax retries, use default pool settings, and tune workers

We were tuning the pool setting within the HTTPAdapter however, there
was no need for us to do this. The defaults should work fine for our
use-case.

We were also setting HTTP retries to 8 which was retry everything 8x
should there be a failure. Retries are now set to a total of 4 with
2 attpemts to connect and 2 attempts to read. This should encourage the
the method to fail faster triggering a function retry instead
exponentialy backing-off and retrying all HTTP issues 8x before
triggering a function retry.

A new constant has been created to auto-tune workers based on the
available CPU workers. The WORKERS constant will now be set to the
number of CPU workers based on information reported by OSLO process.
The value will have a min of 6 and a max of 16.

Related-Bug: #1844446
Change-Id: Ifc2fa6c4da6bd4ce84395192b914a682845128ff
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

[{'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-09-20 17:35:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-09-20 17:55:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

-1 on the missing reference from the commit message. I'm not sure how people feel about the intent of using json.dumps, but it's probably worth tracking down when that was added and why - and if it predates the other in-tree drivers using jsonutils.dumps."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-09-20 17:56:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The other funny thing I don't really understand is why (in nova) RequestSpec.image datatimes are a problem when using the fake rpc driver but only for that prep_resize RPC cast but not for other RPC methods that take a RequestSpec like the scheduler select_destinations call. What is it about the prep_resize method that causes the serialization problem?"}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2019-09-20 18:24:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> The other funny thing I don't really understand is why (in nova)
 > RequestSpec.image datatimes are a problem when using the fake rpc
 > driver but only for that prep_resize RPC cast but not for other RPC
 > methods that take a RequestSpec like the scheduler
 > select_destinations call. What is it about the prep_resize method
 > that causes the serialization problem?

Maybe because prep_resize is the only one to use request_spec.to_legacy_request_spec_dict?"}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-09-21 13:03:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> The other funny thing I don't really understand is why (in nova)
 > RequestSpec.image datatimes are a problem when using the fake rpc
 > driver but only for that prep_resize RPC cast but not for other RPC
 > methods that take a RequestSpec like the scheduler
 > select_destinations call. What is it about the prep_resize method
 > that causes the serialization problem?

RequestSpec.image is only a problem when the rpc is pinned to 5.0 and the RequestSpec is translated to legacy dict. 

The explicit image parameter of prep_resize is the generic problem."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-09-21 13:04:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-09-21 13:07:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

 > > methods that take a RequestSpec like the scheduler
 > > select_destinations call. What is it about the prep_resize method
 > > that causes the serialization problem?
 > 
 > RequestSpec.image is only a problem when the rpc is pinned to 5.0
 > and the RequestSpec is translated to legacy dict.
 > 
 > The explicit image parameter of prep_resize is the generic problem.

The nova.objects.base.obj_to_primitive [1] does a different serialization than NovaObjectSerializer. The NovaObjectSerializer handles object by the ovo's obj_to_primitive that serialize a DateTimeField, like ImageMeta.created_at, to string. While nova.objects.base.obj_to_primitive takes the datetime value of ImageMeta.created_at and simply returns it. Nova sets up the RPC serialization with the NovaObjectSerializer. But there is a few places in nova where DateTimeField is serialized for RPC with the nova.objects.base.obj_to_primitive first  and then passed to NovaObjectSerializer as a dict. One is prep_resize [2]. The other I see is conductor rpc migrate_server with conductor rpc version 1.4 [3] which is old enough not to have any tests on it today.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/09bf71407f4c0d1ddbef89c489ec87c3bca0b7b2/nova/objects/base.py#L241
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/09bf71407f4c0d1ddbef89c489ec87c3bca0b7b2/nova/compute/rpcapi.py#L815
[3] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/09bf71407f4c0d1ddbef89c489ec87c3bca0b7b2/nova/conductor/rpcapi.py#L335"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-09-27 09:41:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I was hoping there'd be someone more familiar with oslo.messaging's history to look at this but it doesn't seem like such a person exists in OpenStack nowadays. The explanation in the commit message is sane and it fixes a bug in nova, so LGTM"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-09-27 13:51:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I was hoping there'd be someone more familiar with oslo.messaging's history to look at this but it doesn't seem like such a person exists in OpenStack nowadays.

Since the code likely originated in nova and was incubated to oslo and eventually turned into oslo.messaging, I'd say Dan Smith is your best bet for historical context on this one."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-09-27 15:43:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

This seems to make sense since I see all of the other calls to serialize json are to jsonutils. The one thing that is preventing me from +2'ing is that I can't figure out where the rabbit driver is doing its serialization. There's no call to dumps or to the common serialize_msg function in it that I can find.

Since the rabbit driver is what most people are using, I'd like to make sure this matches with it. I've pinged a couple of our messaging people directly to see if they can comment. I'm hoping they'll be more familiar with how the driver works."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-09-30 07:35:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Tested with nova unit tests and everything work like expected.

I've no idea too why this driver use json instead of jsonutils.

So, if tests works fine and nobody know the reasons of used json instead jsonutils, so LGTM"}, {'account_id': 29364, 'date': '2019-09-30 07:49:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@ben 
>the rabbit driver is doing its serialization
The serialization happens here:
https://github.com/celery/kombu/blob/master/kombu/utils/json.py#L65

Inside the driver Kombu, with the class `JSONEncoder`

In the impl_rabbit driver:
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/master/oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py#L1221 
the `msg` value is still a python Dict. 

Kombu support different kind of Json Serialization btw'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-09-30 13:42:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> @ben
 > >the rabbit driver is doing its serialization
 > The serialization happens here:
 > https://github.com/celery/kombu/blob/master/kombu/utils/json.py#L65
 > 
 > Inside the driver Kombu, with the class `JSONEncoder`
 > 
 > In the impl_rabbit driver:
 > https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/master/oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py#L1221
 > the `msg` value is still a python Dict.
 > 
 > Kombu support different kind of Json Serialization btw

Okay, that's concerning because it looks like kombu is using json.dumps by default, which may be why the fake driver was using it. Should we tell kombu to use jsonutils or do we need to revert this? As it stands, it would be possible for someone to merge a patch that breaks only the rabbit driver since it's more strict about JSON dumping now."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2019-09-30 14:03:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Okay, that's concerning because it looks like kombu is using
 > json.dumps by default, which may be why the fake driver was using
 > it. Should we tell kombu to use jsonutils or do we need to revert
 > this? As it stands, it would be possible for someone to merge a
 > patch that breaks only the rabbit driver since it's more strict
 > about JSON dumping now.

Making the rabbit driver generate less-strict JSON seems like a bad plan for compatibility as a newer system will be generating less-strict JSON that older systems will choke on (if I'm reading this correctly). I'm also not sure why a less-strict serializer is preferred. What type of object does jsonutils.dumps() let through that json.dumps() didn't?"}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-09-30 14:30:37.000000000', 'content': 'Created a revert of this change as I21f7357362c321bb4ddbfb7763eeeb1f0cbb4fe5'}]

commit_message:
Align message serialization between drivers

Every in tree driver that implements RPC send uses jsonutils.dumps to
serialize the message, except FakeDriver. FakeDriver uses json.dumps.
However json.dumps is a lot more strict than jsonutils. This caused
nova to introduce test specific changes in the rpc handling [1].

This patch makes sure that each driver uses the same json serialization.

I've tried to dig in to the history of the strictness of the
FakeDriver. That driver with the json.dumps() call was added back in
2013 with e2b74cc9e6605156dfd6e36cdfd1b5136161d526. (I cannot link to
that commit in any online way but it is in my local git clone.)
Checking out that commit I don't see any other drivers present in the
repo but the code does mention drivers like RabbitDriver and ZmqDriver
in oslo.messaging/openstack/common/messaging/drivers.py but only there.

Today the oslo_messaging._drivers.common.serialize_msg() call is used
to do the final serialization of the message. It uses jsonutils.dumps
since Icd54ee8e3f5c976dfd50b4b62c7f51288649e112 which is a revert of
I0e0f6b715ffc4a9ad82be52e55696d032b6d0976 that changed from
jsonutils.dumps to jsonutils.dump_as_bytes by mistake. And before this
back and forth it was jsonutils.dumps since the code was imported from
oslo-incubator by I38507382b1ce68c7f8f697522f9a1bf00e76532d. Here
I lost the trail. Honestly I don't know the reason why the fake driver
was made stricter than the real drivers. Still I think today the
strictness is unnecessary as every driver uses jsonutils and even
counterproductive as in [1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/09bf71407f4c0d1ddbef89c489ec87c3bca0b7b2/nova/compute/rpcapi.py#L820

Change-Id: I186305b7897a2a4ce033c11ab9e6bc028854381b
Closes-Bug: #1529084

commit_message:
Allow dumping the placement db in gabbit tests

This patch implements dumping of the placement db to .dot via
osc-placement-tree before and after each gabbit test case.

usage:

  $ export OS_DUMP_PLACEMENT=true ; tox -e functional-py37

then dot files will appear in the ./dots/ directory

Questions:
* Do we want such a thing in placement?
* Is there a way to make the hooking into gabbit nicer?
* Is there a way to get a Config for the dumper easier?

Change-Id: I7753a6aec93fda79d58786c96b6776446a976b15

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-24 18:11:55.000000000', 'message': "Improve ThreadPoolExecutor usage

This change addresses a few different issues with out ThreadPoolExecutor
usage.

Previously we were inefficiently looping on the job results which was a
blocking call and not asynchronous. This change switched the threadpool
usage to use as_completed so we'll handle jobs as they complete rather
than blocking until the the specific job we're looking at completes.

Additionally this switches to use a with statement for the executor so
the threads get cleaned up correctly when we're done with the block.

See example comments:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/concurrent.futures.html#threadpoolexecutor-example

The _inspect call was using a thread pool executor to run session calls
but was essentially a serial executing function so it has been updated
to remove the executor and just call the requests as needed.

Change-Id: Ia7abec997f4e503e1a2db82e05d4fe6e8696defc
Related-Bug: #1844446

commit_message:
Improve ThreadPoolExecutor usage

This change addresses a few different issues with out ThreadPoolExecutor
usage.

Previously we were inefficiently looping on the job results which was a
blocking call and not asynchronous. This change switched the threadpool
usage to use as_completed so we'll handle jobs as they complete rather
than blocking until the the specific job we're looking at completes.

Additionally this switches to use a with statement for the executor so
the threads get cleaned up correctly when we're done with the block.

See example comments:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/concurrent.futures.html#threadpoolexecutor-example

The _inspect call was using a thread pool executor to run session calls
but was essentially a serial executing function so it has been updated
to remove the executor and just call the requests as needed.

Change-Id: Ia7abec997f4e503e1a2db82e05d4fe6e8696defc
Related-Bug: #1844446

commit_message:
Policyd override implementation

This patchset implements policy overrides for nova-compute. It uses
the code in charmhelpers.

This change includes a charm-helpers sync to bring in the policyd helper
code.

Note there are no functional tests for this feature as the charm still
uses the old style non-zaza amulet framework.  The Related-Bug below is
tracking this issue.

Change-Id: If62e7c8433f9db0914c9fc52ae3a140e1b2e287d
Closes-Bug: #1741723
Related-Bug: #1845639

commit_message:
Ensure no LBaaS SG update is triggered for SVCs without selectors and ports

When a Network Policy is enforced we shouldn't try to update the
SG of a LBaaS that would map to a SVC without selector, as this
kind of SVC is not wired by Kuryr. Also, we shouldn't try to update
the LBaaS SG when no ports are defined in the SVC spec.

Closes-Bug: 1845917
Change-Id: I94a288f2b66bd2444d177931f509e1b6ef250235

commit_message:
Ensure pod IP is retrieved from annotation

We are retrieving the pod IP from a nonexistent annotation
field, when should be from the annotations in the pod metadata.
Also, when this information is not present we keep retrying with
the same pod object, which doesn't contains an annotation
causing the controller restart.

Closes-Bug: 1845635
Change-Id: I04095a7d36219175c09d4503f2347ab035d3e242

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iccc8f27f1407baaa73dbc59f0fd1e40ae968307e

[{'account_id': 9076, 'date': '2019-03-23 01:11:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-03-25 11:15:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(5 comments)

Thanks for kicking this off Kris. I'll add this as a proposed topic to our virtual PTG: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/kolla-train-ptg"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-03-25 11:19:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

A potential issue here if we split up the container deployment into two commands (genconfig, deploy-containers) is if only the config has changed, then we won't ever restart the container to pick it up. We could revert to a technique previously used in the reconfigure commands, which is to execute 'kolla_set_configs --check' in the container. There were a few issues with this IIRC - it requires the container to be running (we could easily check for this) and it adds additional config file comparisons."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-03-25 18:40:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I like the idea but not the implementation of it. It blurs the logic.'}, {'account_id': 9076, 'date': '2019-06-15 15:34:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1

Yes, the setting of the varriables are required because the restart handlers all have conditionals on them.  The varriables that I set in each play, all came from the varriables that are set as conditionals on the handlers.

Please look at: https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/zun/handlers/main.yml#L23-L27 as an example.  They pretty much all follow that pattern.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-06-15 15:48:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

 > Yes, the setting of the varriables are required because the restart
 > handlers all have conditionals on them.  The varriables that I set
 > in each play, all came from the varriables that are set as
 > conditionals on the handlers.
 > 
 > Please look at: https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/zun/handlers/main.yml#L23-L27
 > as an example.  They pretty much all follow that pattern.

Yup, I am aware of that. The question was rhetorical. First - it's an alternative (OR), second - the variables are overridden at the task level (https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/zun/handlers/main.yml#L9), third - the relevant one is actually set by the check itself (https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/zun/tasks/config.yml#L112)."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-06-15 15:53:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

(1 comment)

Do not get me wrong, I would love to see this refactored but let's not add unneeded entropy. :-)"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-06-15 20:09:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

I think I see now as to why you did it this way. You have to prevent evaluation of task vars in handler which will result in failure due to lack of config context. It can be shortened by really tricking ansible and overriding only the first var of the expression though it is even blurrier...

Does anyone know why the handlers are equipped with so many checks? In theory notifies should handle checks for them...'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-06-17 15:46:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

> I think I see now as to why you did it this way. You have to

 > really tricking ansible and overriding only the first var of the
 > expression though it is even blurrier...
 > 
 > Does anyone know why the handlers are equipped with so many checks?
 > In theory notifies should handle checks for them...

If we can get https://review.opendev.org/647699 merged then we can remove all those set_facts and forget about it.'}, {'account_id': 9076, 'date': '2019-06-17 21:57:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 9076, 'date': '2019-06-17 22:02:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9076, 'date': '2019-06-17 22:05:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

commit_message:
Add a job that *only* deploys updated containers

Sometimes as cloud admins, we want to only update code that is running
in a cloud.  But we dont need to do anything else.  Make an action in
kolla-ansible that allows us to do that.

Change-Id: I904f595c69f7276e71692696471e32fd1f88e6e8
Implements: blueprint deploy-containers-action

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: I3101a37559fed5876f9d1565a231792bbecfaf58
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Use django.conf.settings instead of local_settings

The default and preferred way of modifying the settings of Horizon
plugin is to add a configuration file to
openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.d/ directory [1]. For that to
work we should use the settings from django.conf.settings and not from
monitoring.config.local_settings.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/horizon/latest/configuration/settings.html

Story: 2006556
Task: 36644

Change-Id: I5cd66954ffb1169f3149cd6f705593efe3a15b13

[{'created': '2019-09-29 17:36:06.000000000', 'message': "Fix openstack-debian-images usage

There's a mistake in the doc concerning the URL of the Debian
repository when using openstack-debian-images. It misses the
/debian folder.

Change-Id: Ie1a401f534f2eae70604f35acdc14c1089b25903
"}]
commit_message:
Fix openstack-debian-images usage

There's a mistake in the doc concerning the URL of the Debian
repository when using openstack-debian-images. It misses the
/debian folder.

Change-Id: Ie1a401f534f2eae70604f35acdc14c1089b25903

commit_message:
NetApp SolidFire: Properly set replication_status

When creating a SolidFire volume with a volume type that has replication
enabled the replication_status of this volume was not changing. This
patch corrects this behavior.

Partial-bug: #1751932
Change-Id: I0207e97903591fc473dc6248d0213f8499254d0c

commit_message:
Remove deprecated option 'ovsdb_interface'

The deprecated ovsdb_interface configuration option has been removed,
the default native driver is now always used. [1]

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/cf37563c8393f964e7f390f13c43070791360cc1

Change-Id: Idd4e8ad4b00064d180a50c7b98a4568804939f50
Signed-off-by: ZijianGuo <guozijn@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2019-09-26 16:25:41.000000000', 'message': "Fix service_user creation

The os_user module in newer versions of ansible (2.8.5) rejects to
create users where the default project is not existing the the user's
domain. So create the magnum_trustee_domain_admin user with an empty
default project.

For details see: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/59876

Change-Id: I8e005df0de39bf2f4790c06ed1b311ff0caa070a
"}, {'created': '2019-09-26 20:13:36.000000000', 'message': "Fix service_user creation

The os_user module in newer versions of ansible (2.8.5) rejects to
create users where the default project is not existing in the user's
domain. So create the magnum_trustee_domain_admin user with an empty
default project.

For details see: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/59876

Change-Id: I8e005df0de39bf2f4790c06ed1b311ff0caa070a

commit_message:
Fix service_user creation

The os_user module in newer versions of ansible (2.8.5) rejects to
create users where the default project is not existing in the user's
domain. So create the magnum_trustee_domain_admin user with an empty
default project.

For details see: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/59876

Change-Id: I8e005df0de39bf2f4790c06ed1b311ff0caa070a

commit_message:
Remove unneeded Zuul branch matcher

We have implicit branch matchers, so there's no need to add a check
for not-ocata etc, a job is only run for the branch it's on - like
master now.

Remove it to not confuse Zuul when multiple branches matches and the job
definition is different.

Change-Id: I09f726819517d065f023f8a4cc8f64ae1615b693

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Idd0da0b65ce19991660cfd067e70ca7bdc141f3a

commit_message:
Update Zuul releasenotes setup

The release-notes-jobs template is setup already, remove
indvidual jobs - they are redundant.

This is a partial backport of I5fbf32b52ec6a5878761e23a5aee592e8c516bca,
it is needed to cleanup the Zuul jobs.

Change-Id: I4589871c7482c8c317c323d9e886169ab8018bd2
(cherry picked from commit dfe50a56c2c882254e332ce62220051725a970b1)

commit_message:
Update Zuul releasenotes setup

The release-notes-jobs template is setup already, remove
indvidual jobs - they are redundant.

This is a partial backport of I5fbf32b52ec6a5878761e23a5aee592e8c516bca,
it is needed to cleanup the Zuul jobs.

Change-Id: I4589871c7482c8c317c323d9e886169ab8018bd2

commit_message:
Add local bindep.txt

As it was announced [1] global bindep-fallback.txt was removed and now
projects need to have a local bindep.txt to be able to install binary
dependencies for testing.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-June/007272.html

Change-Id: I2187f0e63d366fe7d174d0f86bb548535e9eef49
(cherry picked from commit 3f1a317df0aa09c8f66dfc2f8487f79e43ae33aa)
(cherry picked from commit 2aaccf0da92169b705f149d9e91dc11d61dfd50a)
(cherry picked from commit a6037ee5e4acda4e330d0b92df5fabc75540ec68)
(cherry picked from commit 6deaf578e8f780c90b92a7cdf391eabc9d4a7520)

commit_message:
Fix arguments in call to _update_fip_assoc()

The external_port argument was removed from _update_fip_assoc()
in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/680976/ and is no longer
needed.

This commit includes the following unrelated change to
pass the gate.
----------------------------------------
Specify CONNECTIVITY_L2

Necessary after the recent Neutron change. [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678027/

bp boot-vm-with-unaddressed-port
Related-Bug: #1821058
Change-Id: Ia2282f2af5f19f1f7fc82614d2fde5974f7316a2
----------------------------------------

Co-authored-by: YAMAMOTO Takashi <yamamoto@midokura.com>
Change-Id: I36e2c5efe54bfefe1dcf046f87e399e747a7deea
(cherry picked from commit 3017c0f0050e912495cd5ceb155f0bed49016fa1)

commit_message:
Add support for oslo.reports

Oslo Reports enables OpenStack projects to dump Guru Meditation
Reports with useful debugging information on live services
to files or stderr.

Change-Id: I33b6e52870b583c70aa8141ab55d8738beaf5c59

Following the ansible way, I think we should have the boolean returning filters as tests instead.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-07-12 07:18:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Also, what is the reasoning behind changing the current hierarchy of folders? (We already have plugins and tests for them)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-07-12 07:44:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-07-12 07:50:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Following the ansible way, I think we should have the boolean
 > returning filters as tests instead.

I suppose that would make sense. I don't know if there is an equivalent for jinja2.contextfilter for tests though. Perhaps http://jinja.pocoo.org/docs/2.10/api/#jinja2.contextfunction would work, I'm not sure."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-07-12 07:52:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> Also, what is the reasoning behind changing the current hierarchy
 > of folders? (We already have plugins and tests for them)

Just seemed like a nicer way of doing it, and makes testing a little more standard. Also means we can share code in plugins, rather than requiring everything to exist in one file. If we split filters and tests, having them able to share code would be useful, since some of the higher level filters are built on the lower level tests.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-07-12 08:04:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> > Also, what is the reasoning behind changing the current hierarchy
 > > of folders? (We already have plugins and tests for them)
 > 
 > Just seemed like a nicer way of doing it, and makes testing a
 > little more standard. Also means we can share code in plugins,
 > rather than requiring everything to exist in one file. If we split
 > filters and tests, having them able to share code would be useful,
 > since some of the higher level filters are built on the lower level
 > tests.

Ok, I'm buying that. ;-)"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-07-12 08:07:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> > Following the ansible way, I think we should have the boolean
 > > returning filters as tests instead.

 > equivalent for jinja2.contextfilter for tests though. Perhaps
 > http://jinja.pocoo.org/docs/2.10/api/#jinja2.contextfunction would
 > work, I'm not sure.

Seems they don't have context passing implemented for tests (only filters and output functions):
https://github.com/pallets/jinja/blob/fb7e12cce67b9849899f934e697f7e2a91d604c2/jinja2/compiler.py"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-07-12 08:11:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Add custom filters for checking services

These filters can be used to capture a lot of the logic that we
currently have in 'when' statements, about which services are enabled
for a particular host.

In order to use these filters, it is necessary to install the
kolla_ansible python module, and not just the dependencies listed in
requirements.txt. The CI test and quickstart install from source
documentation has been updated accordingly.

Ansible is not currently in OpenStack global requirements, so for unit
tests we avoid a direct dependency on Ansible and provide fakes where
necessary.

Change-Id: Ib91cac3c28e2b5a834c9746b1d2236a309529556
