subject: Remove Nova legacy upgrade
messages:
[{'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-08-23 09:37:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-08-23 09:47:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

KOLLA_BOOTSTRAP then becomes unused in nova - need to remove from script

KOLLA_UPGRADE was used for bootstrapping so it's a bad name but nothing clean comes to my mind as to how to approach the rename, we could uglify that to KOLLA_BOOTSTRAP_OR_UPGRADE... or maybe KOLLA_BOOTSTRAP is the right name for the current KOLLA_UPGRADE"}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-08-23 10:37:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-08-23 10:40:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Good question Radosław. I agree that it makes sense from a Kolla-Ansible perspective to rename it, but I don't know if anyone is using the upgrade / bootstrap mechanism outside of Kolla Ansible?"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-08-23 11:00:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Good question Radosław. I agree that it makes sense from a
 > Kolla-Ansible perspective to rename it, but I don't know if anyone
 > is using the upgrade / bootstrap mechanism outside of Kolla
 > Ansible?

No idea. TripleO for sure does not use it for Nova."}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-08-23 13:08:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-08-23 19:17:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

indeed'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-09-26 17:05:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-09-26 17:05:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Remove Nova legacy upgrade

The rolling upgrade has been the default since Stein. The legacy
upgrade has been removed because it doesn't follow the upgrade
guide [1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/upgrade.html

Change-Id: I2aa879699cb4e9955bf5c38053eada5a53fb6211

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect

will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I44ad38676c1725fb610693a292423aad5ad83c60

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-12 13:48:25.000000000', 'message': 'Add local bindep.txt

As it was announced [1] global bindep-fallback.txt was removed and now
projects need to have a local bindep.txt to be able to install binary
dependencies for testing.

commit_message:
Add local bindep.txt

As it was announced [1] global bindep-fallback.txt was removed and now
projects need to have a local bindep.txt to be able to install binary
dependencies for testing.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-June/007272.html

Change-Id: I2187f0e63d366fe7d174d0f86bb548535e9eef49
(cherry picked from commit 3f1a317df0aa09c8f66dfc2f8487f79e43ae33aa)

centos-release-openstack-ocata package not available.

commit_message:
Move logging from _request() to raw_request()

rest_client log all request and response data when called via its get,
post, put, delete method etc because logging is done in self._request().

But when any service client make API request via raw_request() then logging
is not done.

_request() method internally call the raw_request() method so moving the
logging from _request() to raw_request() will not effect existing behavior.

Change-Id: I096ea150bfdd1d700a15612a391142216f0fd0e8

In the past, the health manager ran on threads, but in

The negative side of this implementation is that

each other, but similar to the previous implementation
you can allocate more resources to either one.

commit_message:
Added mixed worker/thread support to health manager

This patch implements support for a mix of workers
and threads to give the operators more fine grained
control when tuning the health manager.

In the past, the health manager ran on threads, but in
an effort to by-pass GIL related issues these were
converted into workers. I believe that the sweet
spot really is a compromise of the two.

The negative side of this implementation is that
each worker will now handle both health and stats
updates (on separate threads), in the previous
implementation these workloads were isolated from
each other, but similar to the previous implementation
you can allocate more resources to either one.

Change-Id: I4fcf369e0d34326e787aab9af42fccc1a5760d2e

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-19 21:11:12.000000000', 'message': "Use iptables for openSUSE

In openSUSE Tumbleweed, the SuSEfirewall2 package was removed in favor
of firewalld[1]. This commit updates the openSUSE nodeset to use plain
iptables rather than injecting iptables rules into the SuSEfirewall2
service. This will work on both Tumbleweed and Leap nodesets.

openSUSE provides no iptables-service package the way the RHEL family
does, so we can't fall back to that. Rather than try to convert iptables
rules to firewalld syntax, this change leverages init.d to ensure
iptables rules are loaded at boot. The 89-unbound script has been
coopted for this purpose since it already creates
/etc/init.d/boot.local. The usage of `dd` rather than `cat` is
preserved.

[1] https://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-factory/2019-01/msg00490.html

Change-Id: Ia2b72e25078efa68019f1bf7c7a0b77e6ff702fd
"}, {'created': '2019-09-20 19:05:59.000000000', 'message': "Use iptables for openSUSE

In openSUSE Tumbleweed, the SuSEfirewall2 package was removed in favor
of firewalld[1]. This commit updates the openSUSE nodeset to use plain
iptables rather than injecting iptables rules into the SuSEfirewall2
service. This will work on both Tumbleweed and Leap nodesets.

openSUSE provides no iptables-service package the way the RHEL family
does, so we can't fall back to that. Rather than try to convert iptables
rules to firewalld syntax, this change leverages init.d to ensure
iptables rules are loaded at boot. The 89-unbound script has been
coopted for this purpose since it already creates
/etc/init.d/boot.local. Switched from `dd` to `cat` which makes
conditionally composing the file more natural.

[1] https://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-factory/2019-01/msg00490.html

Change-Id: Ia2b72e25078efa68019f1bf7c7a0b77e6ff702fd
"}]
commit_message:
Use iptables for openSUSE

In openSUSE Tumbleweed, the SuSEfirewall2 package was removed in favor
of firewalld[1]. This commit updates the openSUSE nodeset to use plain
iptables rather than injecting iptables rules into the SuSEfirewall2
service. This will work on both Tumbleweed and Leap nodesets.

openSUSE provides no iptables-service package the way the RHEL family
does, so we can't fall back to that. Rather than try to convert iptables
rules to firewalld syntax, this change leverages init.d to ensure
iptables rules are loaded at boot. The 89-unbound script has been
coopted for this purpose since it already creates
/etc/init.d/boot.local. Switched from `dd` to `cat` which makes
conditionally composing the file more natural.

[1] https://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-factory/2019-01/msg00490.html

Change-Id: Ia2b72e25078efa68019f1bf7c7a0b77e6ff702fd

commit_message:
Fix arguments in call to _update_fip_assoc()

The external_port argument was removed from _update_fip_assoc()
in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/680976/ and is no longer
needed.

This commit includes the following unrelated change to
pass the gate.
----------------------------------------
Specify CONNECTIVITY_L2

Necessary after the recent Neutron change. [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678027/

bp boot-vm-with-unaddressed-port
Related-Bug: #1821058
Change-Id: Ia2282f2af5f19f1f7fc82614d2fde5974f7316a2
----------------------------------------

Co-authored-by: YAMAMOTO Takashi <yamamoto@midokura.com>
Change-Id: I36e2c5efe54bfefe1dcf046f87e399e747a7deea

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I5ea287235eb67a172cab26ffd74c4ea8214a8692

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Looking at page 1 of PDF it looks a bit odd for me. There is something like

"Neutron VPNaaS provides Virtual Private Network as a Service (VPNaaS) capabilities to Neutron. Maintained as a separate repo, this works in conjunction with the Neutron repo to provide VPN services for OpenStack. The VPNaaS API is implementation as an extension to Neutron’s networking API:

Enjoy!"

On this page and nothing else. Odd thing is this ":" before "Enjoy". I know that this looks fine in html docs on main docs page but maybe You could change it to some form which would fit better in both formats?'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2019-09-24 14:38:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Actually the ":"/"Enjoy!" show the same on current html docs:
https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-vpnaas/latest/

A quick refresh of this section will be nicer indeed, rest of the generated PDF looks OK https://8c2ccc618746d3759d93-1b102124c6fd0b6d71635117190cffc0.ssl.cf2.rackcdn.com/678754/2/check/openstack-tox-docs/a21d387/pdf/doc-neutron-vpnaas.pdf'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-24 18:10:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-24 18:13:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> On this page and nothing else. Odd thing is this ":" before "Enjoy". I know that this looks fine in html docs on main docs page but maybe You could change it to some form which would fit better in both formats?

I just replaced the colon with a period.

I see two solutions. The one is just to use a period. The other is to skip the top page in PDF (using toctree_only=True in latex_documents in doc/source/conf.py). The latter can lead to a better document structure, but it potentially brings some confusion (e.g., the content of the top page is not shown in the PDF), so I chose the simpler approach.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-09-24 19:33:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Prometheus: Relabeling the node-exporter label

Added the reblabeling config lines to the kubernetes_sd_config key, to
replace the node_name with hostname for Node-exporter. This must now
display the hostname also as one of the labels of the Node-exporter
metrics.

Change-Id: Ic96a890552a1cd2f5e595c37330de048f31a0e75

commit_message:
Fix local_id override in ipsec unit tests

If 'local_id' not in ipsec_site_conn, we can get it from
ipsec_site_conn['external_ip']. Otherwise use it from
ipsec_site_conn['local_id'].

This patch do these:
1. Fix the 'local_ip' error, it should be 'local_id'.
2. Add two tests if the 'local_id' missing.
3. Fix 'local_id' cover tests. Fill 'local_id' to template
'leftid'.

Co-Authored-By: Dongcan Ye <hellochosen@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I4d1ccb6b23d4331ab2951c828c491199fdc46faa

subject: py3: Allow percentages in configs
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-09-27 18:41:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2019-09-27 20:57:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Man... I'm so allergic to monkey-patching that I would rather add ConfigParser(interpolation=NicerInterpolation()) in places where 1% is likely to be present. But okay."}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2019-09-30 01:41:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Brilliant Tim. I started having a poke at this and fell down a configpaser and paste rabbit hole, basically figuring out how it all worked together.

Overriding the default interpolation. Love it.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-27 18:41:24.000000000', 'message': 'py3: Allow percentages in configs

Previously, configs like

    fallocate_reserve = 1%

would cause a py3 backend server to fail to start, complaining like

    configparser.InterpolationSyntaxError: Error in file
    /etc/swift/object-server/1.conf.d: '%' must be followed
    by '%' or '(', found: '%'

This could also come up in proxy-server configs, with things like
percent signs in tempauth password.

In general, we haven't really thought much about interpolation in
configs. Python's default ConfigParser has always supported it, though,
so we got it "for free". On py2, we didn't really have to think about
it, since values like "1%" would pass through just fine. (It would blow
up a SafeConfigParser, but a normal ConfigParser only does replacements
when there's something like a "%(opt)s" in the value.)

On py3, SafeConfigParser became ConfigParser, and the old interpolation
mode (AFAICT) doesn't exist.

Unfortunatley, since we "supported" interpolation, we have to assume
there are deployments in the wild that use it, and try not to break
them.  So, do what we can to mimic the py2 behavior.

Change-Id: I0f9cecd11f00b522a8486972551cb30af151ce32
Closes-Bug: #1844368
'}]
commit_message:
py3: Allow percentages in configs

Previously, configs like

    fallocate_reserve = 1%

would cause a py3 backend server to fail to start, complaining like

    configparser.InterpolationSyntaxError: Error in file
    /etc/swift/object-server/1.conf.d: '%' must be followed
    by '%' or '(', found: '%'

This could also come up in proxy-server configs, with things like
percent signs in tempauth password.

In general, we haven't really thought much about interpolation in
configs. Python's default ConfigParser has always supported it, though,
so we got it "for free". On py2, we didn't really have to think about
it, since values like "1%" would pass through just fine. (It would blow
up a SafeConfigParser, but a normal ConfigParser only does replacements
when there's something like a "%(opt)s" in the value.)

On py3, SafeConfigParser became ConfigParser, and the old interpolation
mode (AFAICT) doesn't exist.

Unfortunatley, since we "supported" interpolation, we have to assume
there are deployments in the wild that use it, and try not to break
them.  So, do what we can to mimic the py2 behavior.

Change-Id: I0f9cecd11f00b522a8486972551cb30af151ce32
Closes-Bug: #1844368

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ifc0438e605d9b0a6d2bc3f88804507bbb5748f3b

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ib3883154563d93ee1487abb86995deceab6b6b5d

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7024fec1c99a352d8d49baeadf2667c953b7e3e4

commit_message:
Egress network policy

This patch set adds in the egress policy for OpenStack services.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/679853/
Change-Id: I77b60235fcc61a1ebf16112ebb25ee7650f64c87
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

subject: Add volume-snapshot backup type
messages:
[{'account_id': 8037, 'date': '2019-06-04 03:19:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8037, 'date': '2019-06-04 10:10:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-06-05 04:14:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi renminmin, thanks for this patch, currently my bandwidth has been fully allocated to https://review.opendev.org/652068, i am going to work on that full time these days. Hopefully it could be finished within this week.

Considering the tramendous change this patch brings, I will definitely take a look after the service tenant model task is finished, because that's the highest priority in T dev cycle. We have plenty of work to do after that.

Thanks for your patience and sorry for the delay."}, {'account_id': 8037, 'date': '2019-07-04 08:56:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-08-14 22:10:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-08-24 10:38:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8037, 'date': '2019-09-02 14:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-09-03 02:32:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Hi @renminmin, thanks for your patience for the review. I just started reviewing the snapshot type backup patch, the whole idea looks OK to me, but in order to make the review process faster and easier, could you please split the patches into separate ones? e.g. one patch for support of creating snapshot type backup, one for creating instance using snapshot type backup, etc. We will see if we could make some of them merged before the end of this dev cycle. Thanks again!'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-09-03 02:33:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I created two separate tasks in https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2005819, feel free to add more.'}, {'account_id': 8037, 'date': '2019-09-16 07:56:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 8037, 'date': '2019-09-16 08:06:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> I created two separate tasks in https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2005819,
 > feel free to add more.

Sure. I will continue to work on this story.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-09-16 08:11:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> > I created two separate tasks in https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2005819,
 > > feel free to add more.
 > 
 > Sure. I will continue to work on this story.

Thanks, I also added two tasks relating to the doc.'}, {'account_id': 8037, 'date': '2019-09-17 02:05:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-09-17 02:07:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

you could rebase on this patch https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682510/'}, {'account_id': 8037, 'date': '2019-09-17 07:36:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 8037, 'date': '2019-09-17 09:49:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-09-17 10:44:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Hi @renminmin, just FYI, we are at RC release stage, after stable/train branch is cut, I'll review the series of your patches asap. Thanks for contributing to Trove (and thanks for splitting the previous 'big' patch)."}, {'account_id': 8037, 'date': '2019-09-18 01:47:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8037, 'date': '2019-09-19 09:38:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8037, 'date': '2019-09-20 06:57:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-09-30 00:22:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

Hi @renminmin, I can see there is a new parameter named 'snapshot' is added as the backup type, but IMHO, how the backup is created should be transparent to the end users but only configurable by the cloud admin. I'm wondering if it really matters for the end user to choose the backup type, given the user can not see the cinder volumes in the service tenant deployment model? Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-09-30 00:34:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

So I'd suggest we add a new file in 'trove.common.strategies.storage' named 'cinder.py' and add the volume management logic accordingly. As a result, the cloud admin only needs to config something like:

```
storage_strategy = CinderStorage
storage_namespace = trove.common.strategies.storage.cinder
```"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-04 03:19:41.000000000', 'message': 'Add volume-snapshot backup type

- Support instance create database backup by attached-volume
  snapshot.
  Request:
  POST v1/{project_id}/backups
  {
    "backup": {
      "description": "My Volume Snapshot Backup",
      "snapshhot": 1,
      "instance": "44b277eb-39be-4921-be31-3d61b43651d7",
      "name": "snapshot"
    }
  }

- Support instance create from snapshot backup

- Support instance create replica by attached-volume clone type.
  Master instacen generate snapshot type backup, then create replica
  instance from generated snapshot backup.
  Request:

    POST v1/{project_id}/backups
      {
        "instance": {
          "flavorRef": 1,
          "name": "json_rack_instance",
          "replica_of": "44b277eb-39be-4921-be31-3d61b43651d7",
          "replica_count": 1,
          "volume": {
            "size": 2
            "type": volume_type
            "clone": 1
          }
        }
      }

Story: #2005819
Task: #33565

Implements: blueprint volume-data-snapshot-backup-type

commit_message:
Add volume-snapshot backup type

Support instance create database backup by attached-volume
snapshot.

Request:
  POST v1/{project_id}/backups
  {
    "backup": {
      "description": "My Volume Snapshot Backup",
      "snapshhot": 1,
      "instance": "44b277eb-39be-4921-be31-3d61b43651d7",
      "name": "snapshot"
    }
  }

Story: #2005819
Task: #33565

Implements: blueprint volume-data-snapshot-backup-type
Change-Id: I403b2cbd49e86393f1307c2e27f218ee4d3af2b7

i really dont think we should add the enable-config-driver paramter.
its not consitent with the other parmater to nova boot which all take an argument.

ignoreing the inconsitency its also longer to type so it  less user friendly in general.

we could raise a waring/error for the volume id but this seam like a needless api breakage if we ever remove --config-drive in the future.

if the api never supported it then there should be no exisig usage of the volume-id. althogh i think matt mentioned on irc that rackspace may have had out of tree changes to support a volume id or that there initall implementation did but it was never upstreamed.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-08-25 22:24:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: -Code-Review

looking at

https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/b013d80ff7ffa75a823f246445a07cb6970d321e

we used to support an image herf which appared to be a uuid way back in folsom so maybe this is just left over from that. e.g. the volum-id could be refering to the same thing? the uuid of the imave/volume to use?'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-08-25 22:24:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-08-27 21:43:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

commit_message:
Add a check for --config-drive option on nova boot

A value of the '--config-drive' option must be a boolean value
on the 'nova boot' command because nova accepts a boolean value
only for the 'config_drive' parameter.
So add a check for the '--config-drive' option on the 'nova boot'
command.

Fix a description for 'config_drive' parameter
in the 'create' method of the novaclient.v2.ServerManager class.

Change-Id: Ic6e65139302fbb662fb6ba60e73633dad8ffb72e
Closes-Bug: #1825061

commit_message:
Remove kolla novncproxy image dependency

Current nova loci image build should account for the nova-novncproxy
image. We can and should reduce the number of images and just use
the loci image instead for the loci build. This applies only to the
Ocata release as newer releases already took this approach.

Change-Id: I01f85a957c3bfdd9f54515de4b02305bde5ead8c
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

'}, {'created': '2019-09-19 08:41:11.000000000', 'message': 'Give the OVN DBS service a separate Vip

This change (with its dependent reviews) creates a separate VIP for the OVN DBS
service. A more detailed explanation can be found in https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1841811.
The short explanation is that the OVN DBS HA service puts some additional constraints on the VIP it
uses and that is problematic when that VIP is used by other services (e.g. a change in OVN DBS master
will move the VIP and will also reset all mysql connections. It also prevents us splitting OVN DBS from
where haproxy runs).

Tested as follows:
A) Deployed a mster environment with this review and all its dependencies and correctly obtained
an OVN DBS service with its own Vip and the OVN services
(controller/metadata) pointing to this separate Vip

B) Deployed a master environment as is and then applied this review +
dependencies and observed that a redeploy correctly created a new VIP,
reconfigured the services to point to the new VIP and that the old
obsolete constraints created around the per-network VIP were removed

Closes-Bug: #1841811

Depends-On: Ic62b0fbc0fee40638811a5cd77a5dc5a4d82acf5
Change-Id: I620e37117c26b5b51bf9e1eda91daeb00fdf0f43

commit_message:
Give the OVN DBS service a separate Vip

This change (with its dependent reviews) creates a separate VIP for the OVN DBS
service. A more detailed explanation can be found in https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1841811.
The short explanation is that the OVN DBS HA service puts some additional constraints on the VIP it
uses and that is problematic when that VIP is used by other services (e.g. a change in OVN DBS master
will move the VIP and will also reset all mysql connections. It also prevents us splitting OVN DBS from
where haproxy runs).

Tested as follows:
A) Deployed a mster environment with this review and all its dependencies and correctly obtained
an OVN DBS service with its own Vip and the OVN services
(controller/metadata) pointing to this separate Vip

B) Deployed a master environment as is and then applied this review +
dependencies and observed that a redeploy correctly created a new VIP,
reconfigured the services to point to the new VIP and that the old
obsolete constraints created around the per-network VIP were removed

Closes-Bug: #1841811

Depends-On: Ic62b0fbc0fee40638811a5cd77a5dc5a4d82acf5
Change-Id: I620e37117c26b5b51bf9e1eda91daeb00fdf0f43

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I8a5ddaaa2186d85ba90bf759e6231decb69f19ec

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28504, 'date': '2019-05-09 16:23:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 26.'}, {'account_id': 7294, 'date': '2019-05-09 23:25:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

(1 comment)

I guess my real question here is, why do we need a whole separate role setup for what is effectively just another configuration of the QDR? Granted, my knowledge of how THT works is limited, so maybe this really is the standard pattern here.

Is there not really a way to define different configurations for the same thing, but apply them separately to controllers vs {other} nodes? Perhaps this is exactly how that happens.

To me this seems like a lot of duplication, but maybe that's just how THT is constructed when you need to apply different configurations to different node types."}, {'account_id': 28504, 'date': '2019-05-10 15:12:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > I guess my real question here is, why do we need a whole separate
 > role setup for what is effectively just another configuration of
 > the QDR? Granted, my knowledge of how THT works is limited, so
 > maybe this really is the standard pattern here.
 > 
 > Is there not really a way to define different configurations for
 > the same thing, but apply them separately to controllers vs {other}
 > nodes? Perhaps this is exactly how that happens.
 > 
 > To me this seems like a lot of duplication, but maybe that's just
 > how THT is constructed when you need to apply different
 > configurations to different node types.

Yep I do agree there is lot of duplication. Let me see if I could achieve the same using the RoleParameters."}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2019-07-26 18:21:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2019-09-27 20:41:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26: Code-Review-1

With latest changes of underlying puppet code the goal will be achieved without necessity for another composable service. This patch is not needed any more. Please abandon.'}, {'account_id': 6924, 'date': '2019-09-29 16:56:53.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

see'}]

commit_message:
Connect Qdrs to SAF (Server Side)

Metrics Qdr service is seperated depending on
where(node type) it is getting installed.
Also the controller nodes connect to qdr's running on
the server side of SAF.

Depends-On: I195dbf70f490984cedb32d48fe09f4562cbf94fa
Change-Id: If786ccda78f035489e65cc27d3b37c83c3bb7d91

commit_message:
Fix pyOpenSSL mapping for RDO

The previous commit turned the mapping into "python-pyopenssl", which
is not what we want.

Change-Id: I613b893b9ae125f6e25a0c15012f7e8bb38c65e8

commit_message:
horizon: Obsolete python-django_openstack_auth

django_openstack_auth was merged into openstack/horizon in Queens
release. https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/horizon/queens.html
calls for uninstalling the old package before upgrading.

Change-Id: I2ada4f1137d7881ffdff5ce1289b231581a67c1b
(cherry picked from commit a9259d086a6e3ce017253fc99a4596ef05bc9d08)

commit_message:
horizon: Obsolete python-django_openstack_auth

django_openstack_auth was merged into openstack/horizon in Queens
release. https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/horizon/queens.html
calls for uninstalling the old package before upgrading.

Change-Id: I2ada4f1137d7881ffdff5ce1289b231581a67c1b
(cherry picked from commit a9259d086a6e3ce017253fc99a4596ef05bc9d08)

commit_message:
Fix compatibility with Pint 0.5

Conversion from Quantity to int/long was added only in 0.5.2.

Change-Id: I23f93d29a0624b77f4624c6af530971eb6a4c01b
(cherry picked from commit 386654f602c86495515811dd741652a3b0292fd3)

I have a pretty serious problem with the fact that there's zero unit test for any of this (cyborg/tests/unit/services/_test_placement_client.py doesn't run because its name starts with an underscore -- I tried renaming it and it doesn't even get past imports -- and I don't even see any attempt at UT for the nova interaction).

But I appreciate the need to get this code into Train, if only to avoid a messy conf support matrix moving forward, and the code itself looks good to me, so I suppose we should land it."}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-09-24 01:48:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Several things have been bugging me about this. Adding to the list, I looked a little deeper into the cyborg-tempest job, and (as I should have realized if I had thought it through) it's not hitting any code paths that would cause cyborg to need to talk to nova. Combined with the lack of unit/functional testing, that means there's nothing actually exercising the code in this patch. I've heard rumors that it has been tested in various local manual devstack type environments, with varying results; but even if all of those reports were positive, IMO it is important that we demonstrate this working in upstream CI.

What this means is that we need a patch somewhere that pulls in this one *and* the nova side [1] and passes test_server_basic_ops such that we can inspect the various logs and prove that cyborg talked to both placement and nova correctly. I see [2], which is a good start; it may be adequate to make it Depends-On this patch and add cyborg to required_projects.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:bp/nova-cyborg-interaction+status:open
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/670999/"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-09-24 19:00:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Better late than never.
- Story against sdk: https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2006614
- WIP patch in sdk for it: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/685043/
- ...which depends on enablement in ksa (also WIP): https://review.opendev.org/#/c/685042/
- But the real problem is that compute shouldn't be requiring auth for version discovery: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1845530
- Functional repro for that: https://review.opendev.org/685180
- And the seed of a fix, for which I need to phone a friend: https://review.opendev.org/685181

Incidentally, in looking for clues for the nova fix, I noticed that several other services (at least cinder and neutron) appear to have the same problem :("}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-09-27 01:54:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

Wow. This is a good tip.'}, {'account_id': 24872, 'date': '2019-09-27 07:13:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2

Thanks chenker for the patch! Since we need this patch for placement_client and CI shows no distinct harm to other project, I will give my +2. But maybe two things should keep in mind:
1) After https://review.opendev.org/#/c/685043/ merged in the future, we may need back here and check again.
2) glance_client part update'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-09-27 12:20:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

> glance and nova are a bit different because it has a dictionary api-server[1]. I am not sure if this item is necessary.

You should get rid of the api_servers conf opt immediately. In fact, that *is* something I would encourage getting into Train before it is released, so you don't have to continue to support it and deprecate it and so forth. Here's the story:

I'm assuming you picked up api_servers when you copied in glanceclient wrappers from nova. I *thought* I had deprecated it in nova when I did [1], but now I see I didn't :(

The point of api_servers was to provide a rotating list of endpoints. When using ksa config (which is what you should be doing - whether actual ksa or sdk - and getting rid of glanceclient) it is superseded by [a load balancer plus] either the service catalog (preferred) or the `endpoint_override` conf option.

TL;DR: It'll go away when you cut glance over to SDK regardless, but you should get rid of it now and just this gorp [2] until that happens.

...which I see you already have in place [3] -- so you should simply get rid of the api_servers conf option entirely and remove this condition [4].

Another example of cyborg inheriting bad debt from nova.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/488137/
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/nova/image/glance.py#L122-L134
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/cyborg/src/branch/master/cyborg/image/glance.py#L120-L132
[4] https://opendev.org/openstack/cyborg/src/branch/master/cyborg/image/glance.py#L113-L118"}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-09-29 01:19:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

> > glance and nova are a bit different because it has a dictionary
 > api-server[1]. I am not sure if this item is necessary.
 > 
 > You should get rid of the api_servers conf opt immediately. In
 > fact, that *is* something I would encourage getting into Train
 > before it is released, so you don't have to continue to support it
 > and deprecate it and so forth. Here's the story:
 > 
 > I'm assuming you picked up api_servers when you copied in
 > glanceclient wrappers from nova. I *thought* I had deprecated it in
 > nova when I did [1], but now I see I didn't :(
 > 
 > The point of api_servers was to provide a rotating list of
 > endpoints. When using ksa config (which is what you should be doing
 > - whether actual ksa or sdk - and getting rid of glanceclient) it
 > is superseded by [a load balancer plus] either the service catalog
 > (preferred) or the `endpoint_override` conf option.
 > 
 > TL;DR: It'll go away when you cut glance over to SDK regardless,
 > but you should get rid of it now and just this gorp [2] until that
 > happens.
 > 
 > ...which I see you already have in place [3] -- so you should
 > simply get rid of the api_servers conf option entirely and remove
 > this condition [4].
 > 
 > Another example of cyborg inheriting bad debt from nova.
 > 
 > [1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/488137/
 > [2] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/nova/image/glance.py#L122-L134
 > [3] https://opendev.org/openstack/cyborg/src/branch/master/cyborg/image/glance.py#L120-L132
 > [4] https://opendev.org/openstack/cyborg/src/branch/master/cyborg/image/glance.py#L113-L118

Thank Eric very much. I will use a new patch for this. Pls review it when you have free time."}, {'account_id': 24872, 'date': '2019-09-29 03:50:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Fix the hardcoding of user role using sdk_adapter approach

1. Refer to nova's latest code, use get_sdk to create the client[1].

2. Move placement_client define from default to seperate placement file.

Note:
The new method for get nova and placement client has been tested in latest
cyborg devstack environment. And the test results are good.

Because now cyborg does not have unit tests for the common and conf directory,
unit tests related to this patch will be added in the future, but not in this patch.

Reference:
[1]. https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/3f019f2db373d82cbc93f0a30de0059d3d07432b/nova/utils.py#L1013

Change-Id: I2a335d47ee3cc24f78b4d49942f1cccd586a0dcc

subject: Update ceph cinder backup driver name
messages: [{'account_id': 23182, 'date': '2019-09-23 09:48:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-09-26 21:16:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-09-28 15:06:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-23 09:48:12.000000000', 'message': 'Update ceph cinder backup driver name

In Stein, Cinder stopped supporting configuring backup drivers without
the full class path.  This means that you must now use the following
values for ``cinder_service_backup_driver``.

* ``cinder.backup.drivers.swift.SwiftBackupDriver``
* ``cinder.backup.drivers.ceph.CephBackupDriver``

If you do not make this change, the Cinder backup service will refuse
to start properly.

Change-Id: Ibf6727ca8397b021c49adc45bdbcd85ac1c1c11c
Closes-Bug: 1844313
(cherry picked from commit 2f64c94ae356838ce8a63719364eb2ee4a5dbaca)
'}]
commit_message:
Update ceph cinder backup driver name

In Stein, Cinder stopped supporting configuring backup drivers without
the full class path.  This means that you must now use the following
values for ``cinder_service_backup_driver``.

* ``cinder.backup.drivers.swift.SwiftBackupDriver``
* ``cinder.backup.drivers.ceph.CephBackupDriver``

If you do not make this change, the Cinder backup service will refuse
to start properly.

Change-Id: Ibf6727ca8397b021c49adc45bdbcd85ac1c1c11c
Closes-Bug: 1844313
(cherry picked from commit 2f64c94ae356838ce8a63719364eb2ee4a5dbaca)

commit_message:
Fix distro install on openSUSE

With Train openSUSE is switching the openstack packages to use Python 3.
This means that we need to use the python3 variants of python-module
packages.

Also switch to stester as the test runner on opensuse.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/683195
Change-Id: Iab011637b8c6954360d4204a05eae49ba3eaaeaf

commit_message:
Move provider_networks into os_neutron

The provider_networks module is currently only consumed by Neutron
(yet it runs inside the integrated repo). This change moves the module
and associated vars into this repo.

Change-Id: Icd6f420f44da8d05f158764c5d335ae9b533e56a
Related-Bug: #1826249

[{'created': '2019-09-26 13:29:17.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Convert dynamic includes to static imports"

This reverts commit 68d2839e1825d942f9afc76a6ee4329b9b031e26.

Change-Id: Ia0227886bd2cc59aab6d2861ef4aa9358d160925
Closes-Bug: 1845497
'}, {'created': '2019-09-26 14:50:20.000000000', 'message': 'Partially revert "Convert dynamic includes to static imports"

This reverts parts of commit 68d2839e1825d942f9afc76a6ee4329b9b031e26.

When running the nova playbooks without having "nova_virt_type" set. It
failed with:

"Error when evaluating variable in dynamic parent include path:
 drivers/{{ nova_virt_type }}/nova_compute_{{ nova_virt_type }}.yml.
 When using static imports, the parent dynamic include cannot utilize
 host facts or variables from inventory"

since the above commit. In ansible it's not allowed to call import_tasks
from a playbook which was included via include_tasks using a dynamic
include path. So we're switching back to "include_tasks" for the
affected playbook.

Change-Id: Ia0227886bd2cc59aab6d2861ef4aa9358d160925
Closes-Bug: 1845497
'}]
commit_message:
Partially revert "Convert dynamic includes to static imports"

This reverts parts of commit 68d2839e1825d942f9afc76a6ee4329b9b031e26.

When running the nova playbooks without having "nova_virt_type" set. It
failed with:

"Error when evaluating variable in dynamic parent include path:
 drivers/{{ nova_virt_type }}/nova_compute_{{ nova_virt_type }}.yml.
 When using static imports, the parent dynamic include cannot utilize
 host facts or variables from inventory"

since the above commit. In ansible it's not allowed to call import_tasks
from a playbook which was included via include_tasks using a dynamic
include path. So we're switching back to "include_tasks" for the
affected playbook.

Change-Id: Ia0227886bd2cc59aab6d2861ef4aa9358d160925
Closes-Bug: 1845497

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic82b9a11b0be82e5f07239a90df156a9f64b263e

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-24 17:39:11.000000000', 'message': "Stop filtering out 'accepted' for in-progress migrations

Live migrations are created with an 'accepted' status. Resource claims
on the destination are done with the migration in 'accepted' status.
The status is set to 'preparing' a bit later, right before running
pre_live_migration(). Migrations with status 'accepted' are filtered
out by the database layer when getting in-progress migrations. Thus,
there's a time window after resource claims but before 'preparing'
during which resources have been claimed but the migration is not
considered in-progress by the database layer. During that window, the
instance's host is the source - that's only updated once the live
migration finishes. If the update available resources periodic task
runs during that window, it'll free the instance's resource from the
destination because neither the instance nor any of its in-progress
migrations are associated with the destination. This means that other
incoming instances are able to consume resources that should not be
available. This patch stops filtering out the 'accepted' status in the
database layer when retrieving in-progress migrations.

Change-Id: I4c56925ed35bc3275ca1ac6c30d7fd641ad84260
Closes-bug: 1845146
"}]
commit_message:
Stop filtering out 'accepted' for in-progress migrations

Live migrations are created with an 'accepted' status. Resource claims
on the destination are done with the migration in 'accepted' status.
The status is set to 'preparing' a bit later, right before running
pre_live_migration(). Migrations with status 'accepted' are filtered
out by the database layer when getting in-progress migrations. Thus,
there's a time window after resource claims but before 'preparing'
during which resources have been claimed but the migration is not
considered in-progress by the database layer. During that window, the
instance's host is the source - that's only updated once the live
migration finishes. If the update available resources periodic task
runs during that window, it'll free the instance's resource from the
destination because neither the instance nor any of its in-progress
migrations are associated with the destination. This means that other
incoming instances are able to consume resources that should not be
available. This patch stops filtering out the 'accepted' status in the
database layer when retrieving in-progress migrations.

Change-Id: I4c56925ed35bc3275ca1ac6c30d7fd641ad84260
Closes-bug: 1845146

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-27 22:35:47.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: [ACL]: Don't use generated address sets

There is a bug in ovn-controller with the OVS conjunction which
prevents Security Group Rules using remote groups and port ranges
from working. So far OVN has excluded input and output ports from
the conjunction clauses [0].

This patch aims to avoid using Address Sets when a remote group is
specified. This is relieving the effect of the bug and it anyways
makes sense to express ACLs in such way.

An example of the offending SGR could be:

openstack security group rule create sg1 --protocol tcp \
--dst-port 1600:1640 --remote-group sg2

Before this patch, the generated ACL would look like:

"outport == @pg_17497425_4b23_46b1_807d_24eec8417dbd && ip4 && ip4.src == $pg_d87c0a0f_0ff6_4f91_b730_bf45af5a158d_ip4 && tcp && tcp.dst >= 1600 && tcp.dst <= 1640"

With this patch, only inport and outport parameters would be used, which
translates into using just reg14 and reg15 in the generated OpenFlow rules:

"outport == @pg_17497425_4b23_46b1_807d_24eec8417dbd && ip4 && inport == @pg_d87c0a0f_0ff6_4f91_b730_bf45af5a158d && tcp && tcp.dst >= 1600 && tcp.dst <= 1640"

TODO:

1) What happens with existing ACLs? We could have a temporary task
that executes upon start and migrates existing ACLs to the new format.
2) Open a LP bug

[0] https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/commit/6f914327a55aaab11507db0911b08d695e17ce2a
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Iaef4ac73b2e4e8b8e92f9da76e4d9da4e874ae67
'}]
commit_message:
DNM: [ACL]: Don't use generated address sets

There is a bug in ovn-controller with the OVS conjunction which
prevents Security Group Rules using remote groups and port ranges
from working. So far OVN has excluded input and output ports from
the conjunction clauses [0].

This patch aims to avoid using Address Sets when a remote group is
specified. This is relieving the effect of the bug and it anyways
makes sense to express ACLs in such way.

An example of the offending SGR could be:

openstack security group rule create sg1 --protocol tcp \
--dst-port 1600:1640 --remote-group sg2

Before this patch, the generated ACL would look like:

"outport == @pg_17497425_4b23_46b1_807d_24eec8417dbd && ip4 && ip4.src == $pg_d87c0a0f_0ff6_4f91_b730_bf45af5a158d_ip4 && tcp && tcp.dst >= 1600 && tcp.dst <= 1640"

With this patch, only inport and outport parameters would be used, which
translates into using just reg14 and reg15 in the generated OpenFlow rules:

"outport == @pg_17497425_4b23_46b1_807d_24eec8417dbd && ip4 && inport == @pg_d87c0a0f_0ff6_4f91_b730_bf45af5a158d && tcp && tcp.dst >= 1600 && tcp.dst <= 1640"

TODO:

1) What happens with existing ACLs? We could have a temporary task
that executes upon start and migrates existing ACLs to the new format.
2) Open a LP bug

[0] https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/commit/6f914327a55aaab11507db0911b08d695e17ce2a
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Iaef4ac73b2e4e8b8e92f9da76e4d9da4e874ae67

commit_message:
Switch upper-constraints URL to static location

During the train cycle, a new static URL scheme was introduced for
upper-constraints URLs that allows us to switch locations based on
configuration and avoid timing windows with the requirements repo
branching. This updates upper-constraints links in the tox.ini file to
point to the newer more prefered location.

Change-Id: I8efbb24483d2a63a8abfa50e328fefb7ffd92e5f
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If7c7fb1831ed873bf783a92ea2d2d124a2292fbd

pasting for context

11:06 < marios> bogdando: i guess they will compare the job run times next week or so

11:07 < bogdando> right, only asking about confirming the concern'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-09-27 08:14:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So my suggestion is instead of randomizing it, modify https://review.opendev.org/#/c/685175 for the non-blocking processing (using the "next" image instead of random), when a worker tries to acquire a lock onto a layer of the current image under processing but has to wait for it.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-09-27 13:43:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The caching part doesn't help because we end up doing processing on the same general containers at the same time.  Fetching duplicate gigs of data is expensive on CPU/Disk as well. I actually found that this is more of an improvement than the other patch so I think there might be other places in the code where the ordering is also impacting. I will continue to investigate but this is an improvement."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-09-27 15:32:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So in testing this with the locking, without shuffle we have an excessive number of layer contentions. The randomization helps prevent us from constantly conflicting as we try and fetch all the various service containers at the same time.'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2019-09-27 21:34:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-09-28 00:42:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-26 17:11:23.000000000', 'message': "Randomize the container list for uploads

When we work through the list of containers in an alphabetical fashion,
we end up duplicating much of the layer fetching because it can occur at
the same time. Things like cinder-api, cinder-backup, cinder-volume
share many of the same layers.  Since we don't ensure that we only do
a single fetching of a layer hash durring the multiprocessing, we end
up duplicating the fetches of layers. By randomizing the fetches, we
reduce the likelihood that we'll be fetching the same family of service
containers concurrently.

Change-Id: Ifbcd55de52c9e2283203b1c6e2adeb266d43eca6
Related-Bug: #1844446
"}]
commit_message:
Randomize the container list for uploads

When we work through the list of containers in an alphabetical fashion,
we end up duplicating much of the layer fetching because it can occur at
the same time. Things like cinder-api, cinder-backup, cinder-volume
share many of the same layers.  Since we don't ensure that we only do
a single fetching of a layer hash durring the multiprocessing, we end
up duplicating the fetches of layers. By randomizing the fetches, we
reduce the likelihood that we'll be fetching the same family of service
containers concurrently.

Change-Id: Ifbcd55de52c9e2283203b1c6e2adeb266d43eca6
Related-Bug: #1844446

commit_message:
Ironic: disallow deployment and cleaning in maintenance mode

This is a common source of confusion for users since ironic essentially
gets stuck in "wait call-back" or "clean wait" state. See e.g.
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1712561

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/683970/
Change-Id: I3b3f6037970e741f93549878e4e36d36297be9c3

file that is usually generated by pbr and instead refer to the published

commit_message:
Follow the PTI for docs

Use sphinx-build instead of the pbr sphinx extention for building docs
as instructed by the PTI[1].

This requires using the sphinxcontrib-apidoc plugin rather than the
autodoc pbr extention. We also remove the reference to the ChangeLog
file that is usually generated by pbr and instead refer to the published
reno release notes. Also fixes the header formatting for the index page,
as the headers weren't rendering at all.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/pti/python.html

Change-Id: Iec8b99fa89877e357cf2e754abad77c9032acad1

commit_message:
Derives NUMA aware vSwitches parameters

Derives the NUMA aware vSwitches parameters NeutronPhysnetNUMANodesMapping
and NeutronTunnelNUMANodes automatically using host introspection.

Change-Id: Ia3a55ec158b16485cd3ffa56d4931b73502a1058
Closes-Bug: #1797925
(cherry picked from commit 675f15376f4ff99c16e59c005ac2ef157baf9431)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-27 12:27:31.000000000', 'message': "Add element for openssh and override UseDNS

We need to disable UseDNS in default sshd_config, which is something we
already do when deploying SSHD service in puppet/services/sshd.yaml but
the parameter is still enabled before Puppet has run, which causes
problems when Ansible has to execute remote tasks via ssh, it timeouts.

This patch adds an element that will allow us to override the default
openssh configuration and it'll disable UseDNS.

Change-Id: I2df6c45936ee88e0eb048998ae23c9334f295fdf
Related-Bug: #1774557
Related-Bug: #1845166
(cherry picked from commit 939b5861e1ff2f5311a16ccf4c63922493159f56)
"}]
commit_message:
Add element for openssh and override UseDNS

We need to disable UseDNS in default sshd_config, which is something we
already do when deploying SSHD service in puppet/services/sshd.yaml but
the parameter is still enabled before Puppet has run, which causes
problems when Ansible has to execute remote tasks via ssh, it timeouts.

This patch adds an element that will allow us to override the default
openssh configuration and it'll disable UseDNS.

Change-Id: I2df6c45936ee88e0eb048998ae23c9334f295fdf
Related-Bug: #1774557
Related-Bug: #1845166
(cherry picked from commit 939b5861e1ff2f5311a16ccf4c63922493159f56)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-13 21:52:20.000000000', 'message': "proxy: Don't trust Content-Length for chunked transfers

Previously we'd
- complain that a client disconnected even though they finished their
  chunked transfer just fine, and
- on EC, send a X-Backend-Obj-Content-Length for pre-allocation even
  though Content-Length doesn't determine request body size.

Change-Id: Ia80e595f713695cbb41dab575963f2cb9bebfa09
"}, {'created': '2019-09-18 16:51:39.000000000', 'message': "proxy: Don't trust Content-Length for chunked transfers

Previously we'd
- complain that a client disconnected even though they finished their
  chunked transfer just fine, and
- on EC, send a X-Backend-Obj-Content-Length for pre-allocation even
  though Content-Length doesn't determine request body size.

Change-Id: Ia80e595f713695cbb41dab575963f2cb9bebfa09
"}, {'created': '2019-09-20 20:08:42.000000000', 'message': "Fix some request-smuggling vectors on py3

A Python 3 bug causes us to abort header parsing in some cases. We
mostly worked around that in the related change, but that was *after*
eventlet used the parsed headers to determine things like message
framing. As a result, a client sending a malformed request (for example,
sending both Content-Length *and* Transfer-Encoding: chunked headers)
might have that request parsed properly and authorized by a proxy-server
running Python 2, but the proxy-to-backend request could get misparsed
if the backend is running Python 3. As a result, the single client
request could be interpretted as multiple requests by an object server,
only the first of which was properly authorized at the proxy.

Now, after we find and parse additional headers that weren't parsed by
Python, fix up eventlet's wsgi.input to reflect the message framing we
expect given the complete set of headers. As an added precaution, if the
client included Transfer-Encoding: chunked *and* a Content-Length,
ensure that the Content-Length is not forwarded to the backend.

Related-Change: I0f03c211f35a9a49e047a5718a9907b515ca88d7
Closes-Bug: 1840507
Change-Id: Ia80e595f713695cbb41dab575963f2cb9bebfa09
"}, {'created': '2019-09-23 17:50:17.000000000', 'message': "proxy: Don't trust Content-Length for chunked transfers

Previously we'd
- complain that a client disconnected even though they finished their
  chunked transfer just fine, and
- on EC, send a X-Backend-Obj-Content-Length for pre-allocation even
  though Content-Length doesn't determine request body size.

Change-Id: Ia80e595f713695cbb41dab575963f2cb9bebfa09
Related-Bug: 1840507
"}]
commit_message:
proxy: Don't trust Content-Length for chunked transfers

Previously we'd
- complain that a client disconnected even though they finished their
  chunked transfer just fine, and
- on EC, send a X-Backend-Obj-Content-Length for pre-allocation even
  though Content-Length doesn't determine request body size.

Change-Id: Ia80e595f713695cbb41dab575963f2cb9bebfa09
Related-Bug: 1840507

[{'created': '2019-08-14 19:25:10.000000000', 'message': 'lxc: make use of filter python3 compatible

_detect_nbd_devices uses the filter
builtin internally to filter valid devices.

In python 2, filter returns a list. In python 3,
filter returns an iterable or generator function.
This change eagerly converts the result of calling filter
to a list to preserve the python 2 behaviour under python 3.

Closes-Bug: #1840068

commit_message:
lxc: make use of filter python3 compatible

_detect_nbd_devices uses the filter
builtin internally to filter valid devices.

In python 2, filter returns a list. In python 3,
filter returns an iterable or generator function.
This change eagerly converts the result of calling filter
to a list to preserve the python 2 behaviour under python 3.

Closes-Bug: #1840068

Change-Id: I25616c5761ea625a15d725777ae58175651558f8
(cherry picked from commit fc9fb383c16ecb98b1b546f21e7fabb5f00a42ac)
(cherry picked from commit e135afec851e33148644d024a9d78e56f962efd4)

(2 comments)

The delta from the Train approved spec is nontrivial. Examining the changes closely, they seem to be fairly simple updates to reflect a couple of issues that were resolved during the last cycle, and to remove a bunch of references that are no longer pertinent.

For future reference, it makes it easier for reviewers in such cases if you upload the first patch set identical to the previously approved spec, and then a second patch set with the changes.

In this case, you may wish to scale back this change set to *only* s/Train/Ussuri/ and enhance the History table, and then propose a separate change set for the deltas. The former would be suitable for fast approval per [1], and the latter should be fairly simple to get approved subsequently.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/readme.html#previously-approved-specifications'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-09-24 00:03:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Re-proposed Nova Cyborg interaction specification.

Describes the Nova - Cyborg interaction needed to create and manage
instances with accelerators, and the changes needed in Nova to
accomplish that.

No changes from Train version except History.

Previously-approved: Train

Blueprint: nova-cyborg-interaction

commit_message:
Update subnet test to not use pre-created share network

This pathc updates 'test_delete_contains_shares' to not use
pre-created share network since the test may fail to delete the
share server and the share network subnet if more shares were
created using the same share network, by other concurrent tests.

Change-Id: I950560ac8040e8deadd21f869f04416153fd8a88

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-19 20:23:25.000000000', 'message': "fix patrole-multinode-admin non-voting gate

The 'patrole-multinode-admin' non-voting gate seems to consistently
fail ServerVolumeAttachmentRbacTest tearDownClass. The failure is coming
from 'test_update_volume_attachment' with the following error message:

Invalid volume: Volume status must be available or error or error_restoring
or error_extending or error_managing and must not be migrating, attached,
belong to a group, have snapshots or be disassociated from snapshots after
volume transfer.'}

The fix is to detach the volume and wait until the detached volume reaches
the 'available' state.

Change-Id: I195115c0d61d15a62cabf3f2b736affbd855cefd
"}, {'created': '2019-09-19 20:24:58.000000000', 'message': "fix patrole-multinode-admin non-voting gate

The 'patrole-multinode-admin' non-voting gate seems to consistently
fail ServerVolumeAttachmentRbacTest tearDownClass. The failure is coming
from 'test_update_volume_attachment' with the following error message:

Invalid volume: Volume status must be available or error or error_restoring
or error_extending or error_managing and must not be migrating, attached,
belong to a group, have snapshots or be disassociated from snapshots after
volume transfer.'}

The fix is to detach the volume and wait until the detached volume reaches
the 'available' state.

Change-Id: I195115c0d61d15a62cabf3f2b736affbd855cefd
"}]
commit_message:
fix patrole-multinode-admin non-voting gate

The 'patrole-multinode-admin' non-voting gate seems to consistently
fail ServerVolumeAttachmentRbacTest tearDownClass. The failure is coming
from 'test_update_volume_attachment' with the following error message:

Invalid volume: Volume status must be available or error or error_restoring
or error_extending or error_managing and must not be migrating, attached,
belong to a group, have snapshots or be disassociated from snapshots after
volume transfer.'}

The fix is to detach the volume and wait until the detached volume reaches
the 'available' state.

Change-Id: I195115c0d61d15a62cabf3f2b736affbd855cefd

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I0e323ce403ac3a05124fb2620c0e0a3df4a60a81
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I0e323ce403ac3a05124fb2620c0e0a3df4a60a81

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: I21d417ac68b1d6f456c73fe0dbceabce3d648f6d
Sem-Ver: feature

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-05 14:13:34.000000000', 'message': "PDF documentation build

It turns out that blank lines are not allowed in tables in
the latex builder. Otherwise, LaTeX complication fails.
A blank line in the docstring of 'bfd' class in os_ken/lib/packet/bfd.py
was dropped to pass LaTeX build.

Note that the structure of the generated PDF is not good (bad enough?).
This will be updated later.

Change-Id: Iec62042d4642d50d411478fadfa09e6a6bbf0a42
Story: 2006099
Task: 35137
"}]
commit_message:
PDF documentation build

It turns out that blank lines are not allowed in tables in
the latex builder. Otherwise, LaTeX complication fails.
A blank line in the docstring of 'bfd' class in os_ken/lib/packet/bfd.py
was dropped to pass LaTeX build.

Note that the structure of the generated PDF is not good (bad enough?).
This will be updated later.

Change-Id: Iec62042d4642d50d411478fadfa09e6a6bbf0a42
Story: 2006099
Task: 35137

commit_message:
Add TODO note for mox removal

MoxStubout fixture in nova/test.py and
filtering warnings in nova/tests/fixtures.py
will be removed after removing unit tests
related to nova-network.
So add notes for them.

Change-Id: I20e51647e66467ebedde01e914484cd02fea6ef3
Implements: blueprint mox-removal-ussuri

commit_message:
[Infortrend] Add Infortrend Manila Doc

This patch updates the Manila administrator reference adding
documentation to the recently introduced Infortrend driver.

Closes-Bug: #1839486

Change-Id: I3332f90bc84fbc8918277d23ab7c51ede16376f2

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I6e6eae6d180b73da62ab6441f769c98b3311f31f

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-27 17:03:19.000000000', 'message': 'Fix monasca-grafana - pin rake to <13

Rake 13.0.0 (released today) depends on Ruby 2.2, but CentOS 7 only
provides Ruby 2.0.

This change pins rake in the monasca-grafana image to versions earlier
than 13.0.0.

Change-Id: Id9a76f459aff016fbc920370c0a3ec58e0397fcb
Closes-Bug: #1845647
(cherry picked from commit a0712ceef3d6c20cdd79417dcff10525c527fb3d)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix monasca-grafana - pin rake to <13

Rake 13.0.0 (released today) depends on Ruby 2.2, but CentOS 7 only
provides Ruby 2.0.

This change pins rake in the monasca-grafana image to versions earlier
than 13.0.0.

Change-Id: Id9a76f459aff016fbc920370c0a3ec58e0397fcb
Closes-Bug: #1845647
(cherry picked from commit a0712ceef3d6c20cdd79417dcff10525c527fb3d)

[{'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2019-09-27 14:45:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2019-09-27 14:45:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2019-09-27 16:31:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28719, 'date': '2019-09-27 16:37:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24780, 'date': '2019-09-27 16:38:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8863, 'date': '2019-09-27 16:58:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

There was no change in these regards for oslo.messaging
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/stable/stein/oslo_messaging/notify/notifier.py#L34
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/stable/ocata/oslo_messaging/notify/notifier.py#L35

The reason it fails now is that py3 low-level ConfigParser does not allow to duplicate options in one section anymore:
configparser.DuplicateOptionError: While reading from '/etc/keystone/keystone.conf' [line 27]: option 'driver' in section 'oslo_messaging_notifications' already exists"}, {'account_id': 8863, 'date': '2019-09-27 17:33:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Just played with MultiStrOpt - indeed using csv won't help. We'll just have the whole string with commas as a one value in a list."}, {'account_id': 8863, 'date': '2019-09-27 18:00:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Indeed, issue is isolated to https://github.com/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/blob/master/helm-toolkit/templates/scripts/_db-init.py.tpl and py3 configparser, no relation to oslo.config so far'}, {'account_id': 8863, 'date': '2019-09-27 18:20:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

something like that https://review.opendev.org/#/c/685454'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2019-09-27 18:23:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

LGTM. I believe this would allow us the general ability to create csv string for any oslo option - not necessarily only for the oslo message, but Pete and others can correct.'}, {'account_id': 8863, 'date': '2019-09-27 18:29:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

works for me'}, {'account_id': 18250, 'date': '2019-09-27 18:51:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2019-09-27 19:15:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
HTK: support csv list in oslo conf rendering

Some configuration options that with older openstack releases
were multistrings have now changed to csv values under a single
key, this change makes that simple to accomodate.

Change-Id: Id941a1e56e4a852d764084c958c13588b8e3ed85
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

Set display_skipped_host to no

This will suppress the tasks if they aren't actually run.

Change-Id: I299fef52f5b69b5482c24fe1cb283e9dd859445d

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Id5c6b7fdc96948d6b0a3c169c3a720374f49d869

messages:
[{'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-09-23 18:19:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-09-27 04:32:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We've been experiencing issues with CI this week and we'd like to have in RC1:
https://review.opendev.org/685036
https://review.opendev.org/683344 (as a FFE)

According to the schedule Sept 27 is the deadline for RC1 so I'd like to wait few more hours and in the meantime try to land the mentioned patches.

Let me know if it's OK or if you can't wait any longer.

Thanks"}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-09-27 08:21:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yes we can hold a few more hours in that case, thanks for communicating with us.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-09-27 19:05:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-09-27 19:07:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Just updated the patch with the right mistral repo hash, please review.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-27 19:52:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks!'}]

> Waiting for FFE

Can you post a link to this FFE? Requirements FFE or a feature freeze exception within barbican? At this point, if a feature is not ready, it really should be deferred to Ussuri.'}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2019-09-27 17:46:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Hi Sean,

I was hoping we would be able to land this Barbican FFE [1] this week, but it looks like we won't be able to.

We'll target Ussuri instead.  Thanks!

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:secret-consumers+(status:open+OR+status:merged)"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-27 19:51:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

OK, thanks Douglas. There'a a little flexibility to "backport" some things before the final RC and release, so if things end up moving along faster than expected you may be able to consider if that's appropriate. Though really at this point the focus should be on stabilizing things for that final release.'}]

commit_message:
Add no_log to include_vars

These appear to be dumping the vars to the logs which is quite verbose
and uncessary. Let's no_log the include vars so we don't end up with the
vars constantly dumped out.

Change-Id: I06a5f893adef4eaf6db17bf5ead4653cfed599f1

commit_message:
Make GreenAsyncPile not hang

It's probably weird that StreamingPile has this interfaces that swallows
exceptions, but this seems better than hanging.

Change-Id: I8fe45c0f0d291efc84f3edf5d6b7cd116b5c7835
(cherry picked from commit 25aeb0ca4905756501e62210a5bc2699c731a1f4)

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I128237449bee102c1176f6c22bada14d0b074839

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ieffc1b87a0f899801f8084ecd01c99c40d3991a9

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-19 10:07:29.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for yum caching when buildah updates

When yum_cache is set, that directory will be automatically
picked as either the source or destination for the containers
being updated as the following:

* when that host directory is missing (or empty), the container
  under update will start populating it, while it gets updated.
  That path going to become the lower overlay FS layer for future
  use among other containers under concurrent yum update executions.

* when the yum_cache directory exists and is not empty, it will be
  bind-mounted as an upper overlay FS layer for other containers under
  update. So those can benefit from some of the already prefetched
  contents in its yum cache without data races or conflicts when
  concurrently accessing the cached data.

Overlaying ensures data safety as each container can only see the lower
layer of the overlay, while storing its local changes on top of it as
an ephemeral. The yum_cache directory existance & non-emptiness facts
act as a single mutex, which only grants a dedicated writing access to
the lower layer to a single "populating" container at a time. This
behavior may be forcefully reset via the force_purge_yum_cache flag.
The container update playbook invoked with it, instantly creates a
new populator and creates a fresh yum cache.

Note that the 100% saturation of the cache is only expected, when the
populating container finishes its execution.

The feature can be used only for buildah in yum update scenarios.

Change-Id: I30c6dd12454a0b1781803ab16ef79b5914178114
Related-bug: #1844446
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

The feature can be used only for buildah in yum update scenarios using
yum or dnf.

Change-Id: I30c6dd12454a0b1781803ab16ef79b5914178114
Related-bug: #1844446
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-09-20 07:46:24.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for yum caching when buildah updates

When yum_cache is set, that directory will be automatically
picked as either the source or destination for the containers
being updated as the following:

* when that host directory is missing (or empty), the container
  under update will start populating it, while it gets updated.
  That path going to become the lower overlay FS layer for future
  use among other containers under concurrent yum update executions.

* when the yum_cache directory exists and is not empty, it will be
  bind-mounted as an upper overlay FS layer for other containers under
  update. So those can benefit from some of the already prefetched
  contents in its yum cache without data races or conflicts when
  concurrently accessing the cached data.

Overlaying ensures data safety as each container can only see the lower
layer of the overlay, while storing its local changes on top of it as
an ephemeral. The yum_cache directory existance & non-emptiness facts
act as a single mutex, which only grants a dedicated writing access to
the lower layer to a single "populating" container at a time. This
behavior may be forcefully reset via the force_purge_yum_cache flag.
The container update playbook invoked with it, instantly creates a
new populator and creates a fresh yum cache.

Note that the 100% saturation of the cache is only expected, when the
populating container finishes its execution.

The feature can be used only for buildah in yum update scenarios using
yum or dnf.

Change-Id: I30c6dd12454a0b1781803ab16ef79b5914178114
Related-bug: #1844446
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
